2334  }
2335  @endcode
2336 
2337  i.e. analysis is performed top-down while transformation is done
2338  bottom-up. If no transformation is applied, the item is returned unchanged.
2339  A transformation error is indicated by returning a NULL pointer. Notice
2340  that the analyzer function should never cause an error.
2341 
2342  The function is supposed to be used during the optimization stage of
2343  query execution. All new allocations are recorded using
2344  THD::change_item_tree() so that they can be rolled back after execution.
2345 
2346  @todo Pass THD to compile() function, thus no need to use current_thd.
2347  */
2348  virtual Item *compile(Item_analyzer analyzer, uchar **arg_p,
2349  Item_transformer transformer, uchar *arg_t) {
2350  if ((this->*analyzer)(arg_p)) return ((this->*transformer)(arg_t));
2351  return this;
2352  }
2353 
2354  virtual void traverse_cond(Cond_traverser traverser, void *arg,
2355  traverse_order) {
2356  (*traverser)(this, arg);
2357  }
2358 
2359  /*
2360  This is used to get the most recent version of any function in
2361  an item tree. The version is the version where a MySQL function
2362  was introduced in. So any function which is added should use
2363  this function and set the int_arg to maximum of the input data
2364  and their own version info.
2365  */
2366  virtual bool intro_version(uchar *) { return false; }
2367 
2368  /// cleanup() item if it is resolved ('fixed').
2369  bool cleanup_processor(uchar *) {
2370  if (fixed) cleanup();
2371  return false;
2372  }
2373 
2374  virtual bool collect_item_field_processor(uchar *) { return false; }
2375 
2376  class Collect_item_fields : public Item_tree_walker {
2377  public:
2378  List<Item_field> *m_item_fields;
2379  Collect_item_fields(List<Item_field> *fields) : m_item_fields(fields) {}
2380  Collect_item_fields(const Collect_item_fields &) = delete;
2381  Collect_item_fields &operator=(const Collect_item_fields &) = delete;
2382 
2383  friend class Item_sum;
2384  friend class Item_field;
2385  };
2386 
2387  class Collect_item_fields_or_view_refs : public Item_tree_walker {
2388  public:
2389  List<Item> *m_item_fields_or_view_refs;
2390  SELECT_LEX *m_transformed_block;
2391  Collect_item_fields_or_view_refs(List<Item> *fields_or_vr,
2392  SELECT_LEX *transformed_block)
2393  : m_item_fields_or_view_refs(fields_or_vr),
2394  m_transformed_block(transformed_block) {}
2395  Collect_item_fields_or_view_refs(const Collect_item_fields_or_view_refs &) =
2396  delete;
2397  Collect_item_fields_or_view_refs &operator=(
2398  const Collect_item_fields_or_view_refs &) = delete;
2399 
2400  friend class Item_sum;
2401  friend class Item_field;
2402  friend class Item_view_ref;
2403  };
2404 
2405  virtual bool collect_item_field_or_view_ref_processor(uchar *) {
2406  return false;
2407  }
2408 
2409  /**
2410  Item::walk function. Set bit in table->tmp_set for all fields in
2411  table 'arg' that are referred to by the Item.
2412  */
2413  virtual bool add_field_to_set_processor(uchar *) { return false; }
2414 
2415  /// A processor to handle the select lex visitor framework.
2416  virtual bool visitor_processor(uchar *arg);
2417 
2418  /**
2419  Item::walk function. Set bit in table->cond_set for all fields of
2420  all tables that are referred to by the Item.
2421  */
2422  virtual bool add_field_to_cond_set_processor(uchar *) { return false; }
2423 
2424  /**
2425  Visitor interface for removing all column expressions (Item_field) in
2426  this expression tree from a bitmap. @see walk()
2427 
2428  @param arg A MY_BITMAP* cast to unsigned char*, where the bits represent
2429  Field::field_index values.
2430  */
2431  virtual bool remove_column_from_bitmap(uchar *arg MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) {
2432  return false;
2433  }
2434  virtual bool find_item_in_field_list_processor(uchar *) { return false; }
2435  virtual bool change_context_processor(uchar *) { return false; }
2436  virtual bool find_item_processor(uchar *arg) { return this == (void *)arg; }
2437  virtual bool is_non_const_over_literals(uchar *) {
2438  return !basic_const_item();
2439  }
2440  /// Is this an Item_field which references the given Field argument?
2441  virtual bool find_field_processor(uchar *) { return false; }
2442  /// Wrap incompatible arguments in CAST nodes to the expected data types
2443  virtual bool cast_incompatible_args(uchar *) { return false; }
2444  /**
2445  Mark underlying field in read or write map of a table.
2446 
2447  @param arg Mark_field object
2448  */
2449  virtual bool mark_field_in_map(uchar *arg MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) {
2450  return false;
2451  }
2452  /**
2453  @returns true if the expression contains a reference to
2454  an expression of the SELECT list of the given query block.
2455  @param arg query block to search in.
2456  */
2457  virtual bool references_select_expr_of(uchar *arg MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) {
2458  return false;
2459  }
2460 
2461  /// Traverse the item tree and replace fields that are outside of reach with
2462  /// fields that are within reach. This is used by hash join when it detects
2463  /// that a join condition refers to a field that is outside of reach, due to
2464  /// equality propagation. See
2465  /// Item_func::ensure_multi_equality_fields_are_available_walker for more
2466  /// details.
2467  virtual bool ensure_multi_equality_fields_are_available_walker(uchar *) {
2468  return false;
2469  }
2470 
2471  protected:
2472  /**
2473  Helper function for mark_field_in_map(uchar *arg).
2474 
2475  @param mark_field Mark_field object
2476  @param field Field to be marked for read/write
2477  */
2478  static inline bool mark_field_in_map(Mark_field *mark_field, Field *field) {
2479  TABLE *table = mark_field->table;
2480  if (table != nullptr && table != field->table) return false;
2481 
2482  table = field->table;
2483  table->mark_column_used(field, mark_field->mark);
2484 
2485  return false;
2486  }
2487 
2488  public:
2489  /**
2490  Reset execution state for such window function types
2491  as determined by arg
2492 
2493  @param arg pointing to a bool which, if true, says to reset state
2494  for framing window function, else for non-framing
2495  */
2496  virtual bool reset_wf_state(uchar *arg MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) {
2497  return false;
2498  }
2499 
2500  /**
2501  Return used table information for the specified query block (level).
2502  For a field that is resolved from this query block, return the table number.
2503  For a field that is resolved from a query block outer to the specified one,
2504  return OUTER_REF_TABLE_BIT
2505 
2506  @param[in,out] arg pointer to an instance of class Used_tables, which is
2507  constructed with the query block as argument.
2508  The used tables information is accumulated in the field
2509  used_tables in this class.
2510 
2511  @note This function is used to update used tables information after
2512  merging a query block (a subquery) with its parent.
2513  */
2514  virtual bool used_tables_for_level(uchar *arg MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) {
2515  return false;
2516  }
2517  /**
2518  Check privileges.
2519 
2520  @param thd thread handle
2521  */
2522  virtual bool check_column_privileges(uchar *thd MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) {
2523  return false;
2524  }
2525  virtual bool inform_item_in_cond_of_tab(uchar *) { return false; }
2526  /**
2527  Bind objects from the current execution context to field objects in
2528  item trees. Typically used to bind Field objects from TABLEs to
2529  Item_field objects.
2530  */
2531  virtual void bind_fields() {}
2532 
2533  struct Cleanup_after_removal_context {
2534  /**
2535  Pointer to Cleanup_after_removal_context containing from which
2536  select the walk started, i.e., the SELECT_LEX that contained the clause
2537  that was removed.
2538  */
2539  SELECT_LEX *m_root;
2540 
2541  Cleanup_after_removal_context(SELECT_LEX *root) : m_root(root) {}
2542  };
2543  /**
2544  Clean up after removing the item from the item tree.
2545 
2546  param arg pointer to a Cleanup_after_removal_context object
2547  */
2548  virtual bool clean_up_after_removal(uchar *) { return false; }
2549 
2550  /**
2551  Propagate components that use referenced columns from derived tables.
2552  Some columns from derived tables may be determined to be unused, but
2553  may actually reference other columns that are used. This function will
2554  return true for such columns when called with Item::walk(), which then
2555  means that this column can also be marked as used.
2556  @see also SELECT_LEX::delete_unused_merged_columns().
2557  */
2558  bool propagate_derived_used(uchar *) { return is_derived_used(); }
2559 
2560  /**
2561  Called by Item::walk() to set all the referenced items' derived_used flag.
2562  */
2563  bool propagate_set_derived_used(uchar *) {
2564  set_derived_used();
2565  return false;
2566  }
2567 
2568  /// @see Distinct_check::check_query()
2569  virtual bool aggregate_check_distinct(uchar *) { return false; }
2570  /// @see Group_check::check_query()
2571  virtual bool aggregate_check_group(uchar *) { return false; }
2572  /// @see Group_check::analyze_conjunct()
2573  virtual bool is_strong_side_column_not_in_fd(uchar *) { return false; }
2574  /// @see Group_check::is_in_fd_of_underlying()
2575  virtual bool is_column_not_in_fd(uchar *) { return false; }
2576  virtual Bool3 local_column(const SELECT_LEX *) const {
2577  return Bool3::false3();
2578  }
2579 
2580  /**
2581  Context struct used by walk method collect_scalar_subqueries to
2582  accumulate information about scalar subqueries found.
2583 
2584  In: m_location of expression walked, m_join_condition_context
2585  Out: m_list
2586  */
2587  struct Collect_scalar_subquery_info : public Item_tree_walker {
2588  enum Location { L_SELECT = 1, L_WHERE = 2, L_HAVING = 4, L_JOIN_COND = 8 };
2589  /// Information about one scalar subquery
2590  struct Css_info {
2591  int8 m_location; ///< set of locations
2592  /// the scalar subquery
2593  Item_singlerow_subselect *item;
2594  /// Where did we find item above? Used when m_location == L_JOIN_COND,
2595  /// nullptr for other locations.
2596  Item *m_join_condition;
2597  /// If true, we can forego cardinality checking of the derived table
2598  bool m_implicitly_grouped_and_no_union;
2599  };
2600 
2601  /// accumulated all scalar subqueries found
2602  std::vector<Css_info> m_list;
2603  /// we are currently looking at this kind of clause, cf. enum Location
2604  int8 m_location{0};
2605  Item *m_join_condition_context{nullptr};
2606  Collect_scalar_subquery_info() {}
2607  friend class Item_sum;
2608  friend class Item_singlerow_subselect;
2609  };
2610 
2611  virtual bool collect_scalar_subqueries(uchar *) { return false; }
2612  virtual bool collect_grouped_aggregates(uchar *) { return false; }
2613  virtual bool collect_subqueries(uchar *) { return false; }
2614  virtual bool update_depended_from(uchar *) { return false; }
2615  /**
2616  Check if an aggregate is referenced from within the GROUP BY
2617  clause of the query block in which it is aggregated. Such
2618  references will be rejected.
2619  @see Item_ref::fix_fields()
2620  @retval true if this is an aggregate which is referenced from
2621  the GROUP BY clause of the aggregating query block
2622  @retval false otherwise
2623  */
2624  virtual bool has_aggregate_ref_in_group_by(uchar *) { return false; }
2625 
2626  virtual bool visit_all_analyzer(uchar **) { return true; }
2627  virtual bool cache_const_expr_analyzer(uchar **cache_item);
2628  Item *cache_const_expr_transformer(uchar *item);
2629 
2630  virtual bool equality_substitution_analyzer(uchar **) { return false; }
2631 
2632  virtual Item *equality_substitution_transformer(uchar *) { return this; }
2633 
2634  /**
2635  Check if a partition function is allowed.
2636 
2637  @return whether a partition function is not accepted
2638 
2639  @details
2640  check_partition_func_processor is used to check if a partition function
2641  uses an allowed function. An allowed function will always ensure that
2642  X=Y guarantees that also part_function(X)=part_function(Y) where X is
2643  a set of partition fields and so is Y. The problems comes mainly from
2644  character sets where two equal strings can be quite unequal. E.g. the
2645  german character for double s is equal to 2 s.
2646 
2647  The default is that an item is not allowed
2648  in a partition function. Allowed functions
2649  can never depend on server version, they cannot depend on anything
2650  related to the environment. They can also only depend on a set of
2651  fields in the table itself. They cannot depend on other tables and
2652  cannot contain any queries and cannot contain udf's or similar.
2653  If a new Item class is defined and it inherits from a class that is
2654  allowed in a partition function then it is very important to consider
2655  whether this should be inherited to the new class. If not the function
2656  below should be defined in the new Item class.
2657 
2658  The general behaviour is that most integer functions are allowed.
2659  If the partition function contains any multi-byte collations then
2660  the function check_part_func_fields will report an error on the
2661  partition function independent of what functions are used. So the
2662  only character sets allowed are single character collation and
2663  even for those only a limited set of functions are allowed. The
2664  problem with multi-byte collations is that almost every string
2665  function has the ability to change things such that two strings
2666  that are equal will not be equal after manipulated by a string
2667  function. E.g. two strings one contains a double s, there is a
2668  special german character that is equal to two s. Now assume a
2669  string function removes one character at this place, then in
2670  one the double s will be removed and in the other there will
2671  still be one s remaining and the strings are no longer equal
2672  and thus the partition function will not sort equal strings into
2673  the same partitions.
2674 
2675  So the check if a partition function is valid is two steps. First
2676  check that the field types are valid, next check that the partition
2677  function is valid. The current set of partition functions valid
2678  assumes that there are no multi-byte collations amongst the partition
2679  fields.
2680  */
2681  virtual bool check_partition_func_processor(uchar *) { return true; }
2682  virtual bool subst_argument_checker(uchar **arg) {
2683  if (*arg) *arg = nullptr;
2684  return true;
2685  }
2686  virtual bool explain_subquery_checker(uchar **) { return true; }
2687  virtual Item *explain_subquery_propagator(uchar *) { return this; }
2688 
2689  virtual Item *equal_fields_propagator(uchar *) { return this; }
2690  // Mark the item to not be part of substitution.
2691  virtual bool disable_constant_propagation(uchar *) { return false; }
2692  virtual Item *replace_equal_field(uchar *) { return this; }
2693  /*
2694  Check if an expression value has allowed arguments, like DATE/DATETIME
2695  for date functions. Also used by partitioning code to reject
2696  timezone-dependent expressions in a (sub)partitioning function.
2697  */
2698  virtual bool check_valid_arguments_processor(uchar *) { return false; }
2699 
2700  /**
2701  Check if this item is allowed for a virtual column or inside a
2702  default expression. Should be overridden in child classes.
2703 
2704  @param[in,out] args Due to the limitation of Item::walk()
2705  it is declared as a pointer to uchar, underneath there's a actually a
2706  structure of type Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters.
2707  It is used mainly in Item_field.
2708 
2709  @returns true if function is not accepted
2710  */
2711  virtual bool check_function_as_value_generator(uchar *args);
2712 
2713  /**
2714  Check if a generated expression depends on DEFAULT function with
2715  specific column name as argument.
2716 
2717  @param[in] args Name of column used as DEFAULT function argument.
2718 
2719  @returns false if the function is not DEFAULT(args), otherwise true.
2720  */
2721  virtual bool check_gcol_depend_default_processor(
2722  uchar *args MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) {
2723  return false;
2724  }
2725  /**
2726  Check if all the columns present in this expression are from the
2727  derived table. Used in determining if a condition can be pushed
2728  down to derived table.
2729  */
2730  virtual bool check_column_from_derived_table(
2731  uchar *arg MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) {
2732  // A generic item cannot be pushed down unless constant.
2733  return !const_item();
2734  }
2735 
2736  /**
2737  Check if all the columns present in this expression are present
2738  in PARTITION clause of window functions of the derived table.
2739  Used in checking if a condition can be pushed down to derived table.
2740  */
2741  virtual bool check_column_in_window_functions(
2742  uchar *arg MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) {
2743  return false;
2744  }
2745  /**
2746  Check if all the columns present in this expression are present
2747  in GROUP BY clause of the derived table. Used in checking if
2748  a condition can be pushed down to derived table.
2749  */
2750  virtual bool check_column_in_group_by(uchar *arg MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) {
2751  return false;
2752  }
2753  /**
2754  Assuming this expression is part of a condition that would be pushed to the
2755  WHERE clause of a materialized derived table, replace, in this expression,
2756  each derived table's column with a clone of the expression lying under it
2757  in the derived table's definition. We replace with a clone, because the
2758  condition can be pushed further down in case of nested derived tables.
2759  */
2760  virtual Item *replace_with_derived_expr(uchar *arg MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) {
2761  return this;
2762  }
2763  /**
2764  Assuming this expression is part of a condition that would be pushed to the
2765  HAVING clause of a materialized derived table, replace, in this expression,
2766  each derived table's column with a reference to the expression lying under
2767  it in the derived table's definition. Unlike replace_with_derived_expr, a
2768  clone is not used because HAVING condition will not be pushed further
2769  down in case of nested derived tables.
2770  */
2771  virtual Item *replace_with_derived_expr_ref(
2772  uchar *arg MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) {
2773  return this;
2774  }
2775  /*
2776  For SP local variable returns pointer to Item representing its
2777  current value and pointer to current Item otherwise.
2778  */
2779  virtual Item *this_item() { return this; }
2780  virtual const Item *this_item() const { return this; }
2781 
2782  /*
2783  For SP local variable returns address of pointer to Item representing its
2784  current value and pointer passed via parameter otherwise.
2785  */
2786  virtual Item **this_item_addr(THD *, Item **addr_arg) { return addr_arg; }
2787 
2788  // Row emulation
2789  virtual uint cols() const { return 1; }
2790  virtual Item *element_index(uint) { return this; }
2791  virtual Item **addr(uint) { return nullptr; }
2792  virtual bool check_cols(uint c);
2793  // It is not row => null inside is impossible
2794  virtual bool null_inside() { return false; }
2795  // used in row subselects to get value of elements
2796  virtual void bring_value() {}
2797 
2798  Field *tmp_table_field_from_field_type(TABLE *table, bool fixed_length) const;
2799  virtual Item_field *field_for_view_update() { return nullptr; }
2800  /**
2801  Informs an item that it is wrapped in a truth test, in case it wants to
2802  transforms itself to implement this test by itself.
2803  @param thd Thread handle
2804  @param test Truth test
2805  */
2806  virtual Item *truth_transformer(THD *thd MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused)),
2807  Bool_test test MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) {
2808  return nullptr;
2809  }
2810  virtual Item *update_value_transformer(uchar *) { return this; }
2811 
2812  struct Item_replacement {
2813  SELECT_LEX *m_trans_block; ///< Transformed query block
2814  SELECT_LEX *m_curr_block; ///< Transformed query block or a contained
2815  ///< subquery. Pushed when diving into
2816  ///< subqueries.
2817  Item_replacement(SELECT_LEX *transformed_block, SELECT_LEX *current_block)
2818  : m_trans_block(transformed_block), m_curr_block(current_block) {}
2819  };
2820  struct Item_field_replacement : Item_replacement {
2821  Field *m_target; ///< The field to be replaced
2822  Item_field *m_item; ///< The replacement field
2823  bool m_keep_alias{false}; ///< Needed for SELECT list alias preservation
2824  Item_field_replacement(Field *target, Item_field *item, SELECT_LEX *select,
2825  bool keep)
2826  : Item_replacement(select, select),
2827  m_target(target),
2828  m_item(item),
2829  m_keep_alias(keep) {}
2830  };
2831 
2832  struct Item_view_ref_replacement : Item_replacement {
2833  Item *m_target; ///< The item identifying the view_ref to be replaced
2834  Field *m_field; ///< The replacement field
2835  ///< subquery. Pushed when diving into
2836  ///< subqueries.
2837  Item_view_ref_replacement(Item *target, Field *field, SELECT_LEX *select)
2838  : Item_replacement(select, select), m_target(target), m_field(field) {}
2839  };
2840 
2841  struct Aggregate_replacement {
2842  Item_sum *m_target;
2843  Item_field *m_replacement;
2844  Aggregate_replacement(Item_sum *target, Item_field *replacement)
2845  : m_target(target), m_replacement(replacement) {}
2846  };

2848  /**
2849  When walking the item tree seeing an Item_singlerow_subselect matching
2850  a target, replace it with a substitute field used when transforming
2851  scalar subqueries into derived tables. Cf.
2852  SELECT_LEX::transform_scalar_subqueries_to_join_with_derived.
2853  */
2854  virtual Item *replace_scalar_subquery(uchar *) { return this; }
2855 
2856  /**
2857  Transform processor used by SELECT_LEX::transform_grouped_to_derived
2858  to replace fields which used to be at the transformed query block
2859  with corresponding fields in the new derived table containing the grouping
2860  operation of the original transformed query block.
2861  */
2862  virtual Item *replace_item_field(uchar *) { return this; }
2863  virtual Item *replace_item_view_ref(uchar *) { return this; }
2864  virtual Item *replace_aggregate(uchar *) { return this; }

2870  : m_target(target), m_owner(owner) {}

2876  virtual bool update_aggr_refs(uchar *) { return false; }
2877 
2878  virtual Item *safe_charset_converter(THD *thd, const CHARSET_INFO *tocs);
2879  /**
2880  Delete this item.
2881  Note that item must have been cleanup up by calling Item::cleanup().
2882  */
2883  void delete_self() { delete this; }
2884 
2885  /** @return whether the item is local to a stored procedure */
2886  virtual bool is_splocal() const { return false; }
2887 
2888  /*
2889  Return Settable_routine_parameter interface of the Item. Return 0
2890  if this Item is not Settable_routine_parameter.
2891  */
2892  virtual Settable_routine_parameter *get_settable_routine_parameter() {
2893  return nullptr;
2894  }
2895  inline bool is_temporal_with_date() const {
2896  return is_temporal_type_with_date(real_type_to_type(data_type()));
2897  }
2898  inline bool is_temporal_with_date_and_time() const {
2899  return is_temporal_type_with_date_and_time(real_type_to_type(data_type()));
2900  }
2901  inline bool is_temporal_with_time() const {
2902  return is_temporal_type_with_time(real_type_to_type(data_type()));
2903  }
2904  inline bool is_temporal() const {
2905  return is_temporal_type(real_type_to_type(data_type()));
2906  }
2907  /**
2908  Check whether this and the given item has compatible comparison context.
2909  Used by the equality propagation. See Item_field::equal_fields_propagator.
2910 
2911  @return
2912  true if the context is the same or if fields could be
2913  compared as DATETIME values by the Arg_comparator.
2914  false otherwise.
2915  */
2916  inline bool has_compatible_context(Item *item) const {
2917  /* Same context. */
2918  if (cmp_context == INVALID_RESULT || item->cmp_context == cmp_context)
2919  return true;
2920  /* DATETIME comparison context. */
2921  if (is_temporal_with_date())
2922  return item->is_temporal_with_date() ||
2923  item->cmp_context == STRING_RESULT;
2924  if (item->is_temporal_with_date())
2925  return is_temporal_with_date() || cmp_context == STRING_RESULT;
2926  return false;
2927  }
2928  virtual Field::geometry_type get_geometry_type() const {
2929  return Field::GEOM_GEOMETRY;
2930  }
2931  String *check_well_formed_result(String *str, bool send_error, bool truncate);
2932  bool eq_by_collation(Item *item, bool binary_cmp, const CHARSET_INFO *cs);
2933 
2934  /*
2935  Test whether an expression is expensive to compute. Used during
2936  optimization to avoid computing expensive expressions during this
2937  phase. Also used to force temp tables when sorting on expensive
2938  functions.
2939  TODO:
2940  Normally we should have a method:
2941  cost Item::execution_cost(),
2942  where 'cost' is either 'double' or some structure of various cost
2943  parameters.
2944  */
2945  virtual bool is_expensive() {
2946  if (is_expensive_cache < 0)
2947  is_expensive_cache =
2948  walk(&Item::is_expensive_processor, enum_walk::POSTFIX, nullptr);
2949  return is_expensive_cache;
2950  }
2951 
2952  /**
2953  @return maximum number of characters that this Item can store
2954  If Item is of string or blob type, return max string length in bytes
2955  divided by bytes per character, otherwise return max_length.
2956  @todo - check if collation for other types should have mbmaxlen = 1
2957  */
2958  uint32 max_char_length() const {
2959  /*
2960  Length of e.g. 5.5e5 in an expression such as GREATEST(5.5e5, '5') is 5
2961  (length of that string) although length of the actual value is 6.
2962  Return MAX_DOUBLE_STR_LENGTH to prevent truncation of data without having
2963  to evaluate the value of the item.
2964  */
2965  uint32 max_len =
2966  data_type() == MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE ? MAX_DOUBLE_STR_LENGTH : max_length;
2967  if (result_type() == STRING_RESULT)
2968  return max_len / collation.collation->mbmaxlen;
2969  return max_len;
2970  }
2971 
2972  inline void fix_char_length(uint32 max_char_length_arg) {
2973  max_length = char_to_byte_length_safe(max_char_length_arg,
2974  collation.collation->mbmaxlen);
2975  }
2976 
2977  /*
2978  Return true if the item points to a column of an outer-joined table.
2979  */
2980  virtual bool is_outer_field() const {
2981  DBUG_ASSERT(fixed);
2982  return false;
2983  }
2984 
2985  /**
2986  Check if an item either is a blob field, or will be represented as a BLOB
2987  field if a field is created based on this item.
2988 
2989  @retval true If a field based on this item will be a BLOB field,
2990  @retval false Otherwise.
2991  */
2992  bool is_blob_field() const;
2993 
2994  protected:
2995  /// Set accumulated properties for an Item
2996  void set_accum_properties(const Item *item) {
2997  m_accum_properties = item->m_accum_properties;
2998  }
2999 
3000  /// Add more accumulated properties to an Item
3001  void add_accum_properties(const Item *item) {
3002  m_accum_properties |= item->m_accum_properties;
3003  }
3004 
3005  /// Set the "has subquery" property
3006  void set_subquery() { m_accum_properties |= PROP_SUBQUERY; }
3007 
3008  /// Set the "has stored program" property
3009  void set_stored_program() { m_accum_properties |= PROP_STORED_PROGRAM; }
3010 
3011  public:
3012  /// @return true if this item or any of its decendents contains a subquery.
3013  bool has_subquery() const { return m_accum_properties & PROP_SUBQUERY; }
3014 
3015  /// @return true if this item or any of its decendents refers a stored func.
3016  bool has_stored_program() const {
3017  return m_accum_properties & PROP_STORED_PROGRAM;
3018  }
3019 
3020  /// @return true if this item or any of its decendents is an aggregated func.
3021  bool has_aggregation() const { return m_accum_properties & PROP_AGGREGATION; }
3022 
3023  /// Set the "has aggregation" property
3024  void set_aggregation() { m_accum_properties |= PROP_AGGREGATION; }
3025 
3026  /// Reset the "has aggregation" property
3027  void reset_aggregation() { m_accum_properties &= ~PROP_AGGREGATION; }
3028 
3029  /// @return true if this item or any of its decendents is a window func.
3030  bool has_wf() const { return m_accum_properties & PROP_WINDOW_FUNCTION; }
3031 
3032  /// Set the "has window function" property
3033  void set_wf() { m_accum_properties |= PROP_WINDOW_FUNCTION; }
3034 
3035  /**
3036  @return true if this item or any of its decendents within the same query
3037  has a reference to a ROLLUP expression
3038  */
3039  bool has_rollup_expr() const { return m_accum_properties & PROP_ROLLUP_EXPR; }
3040 
3041  /// Set the property: this item (tree) contains a reference to a ROLLUP expr
3042  void set_rollup_expr() { m_accum_properties |= PROP_ROLLUP_EXPR; }
3043 
3044  /**
3045  @return true if this item or any of underlying items is a GROUPING function
3046  */
3047  bool has_grouping_func() const {
3048  return m_accum_properties & PROP_GROUPING_FUNC;
3049  }
3050 
3051  /// Set the property: this item is a call to GROUPING
3052  void set_grouping_func() { m_accum_properties |= PROP_GROUPING_FUNC; }
3053 
3054  /// Whether this Item was created by the IN->EXISTS subquery transformation
3055  virtual bool created_by_in2exists() const { return false; }
3056 
3057  // @return true if an expression in select list of derived table is used
3058  bool is_derived_used() const { return derived_used; }
3059 
3060  void mark_subqueries_optimized_away() {
3061  if (has_subquery())
3062  walk(&Item::subq_opt_away_processor, enum_walk::POSTFIX, nullptr);
3063  }

3065  /**
3066  Analyzer function for GC substitution. @see substitute_gc()
3067  */
3068  virtual bool gc_subst_analyzer(uchar **) { return false; }
3069  /**
3070  Transformer function for GC substitution. @see substitute_gc()
3071  */
3072  virtual Item *gc_subst_transformer(uchar *) { return this; }
3073 
3074  /**
3075  A processor that replaces any Fields with a Create_field_wrapper. This
3076  will allow us to resolve functions during CREATE TABLE, where we only have
3077  Create_field available and not Field. Used for functional index
3078  implementation.
3079  */
3080  virtual bool replace_field_processor(uchar *) { return false; }
3081  /**
3082  Check if this item is of a type that is eligible for GC
3083  substitution. All items that belong to subclasses of Item_func are
3084  eligible for substitution. @see substitute_gc()
3085  */
3086  bool can_be_substituted_for_gc() const {
3087  const Type t = type();
3088  return t == FUNC_ITEM || t == COND_ITEM;
3089  }

3092  void aggregate_float_properties(Item **item, uint nitems);
3093  void aggregate_char_length(Item **args, uint nitems);

3095  bool aggregate_string_properties(const char *name, Item **item, uint nitems);
3096  void aggregate_num_type(Item_result result_type, Item **item, uint nitems);

3098  /**
3099  This function applies only to Item_field objects referred to by an Item_ref
3100  object that has been marked as a const_item.
3101 
3102  @param arg Keep track of whether an Item_ref refers to an Item_field.
3103  */
3104  virtual bool repoint_const_outer_ref(uchar *arg MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) {
3105  return false;
3106  }
3107  virtual bool strip_db_table_name_processor(uchar *) { return false; }
3108 
3109  private:
3110  virtual bool subq_opt_away_processor(uchar *) { return false; }
3111 
3112  // Set an expression from select list of derived table as used.
3113  void set_derived_used() { derived_used = true; }
3114 
3115  public: // Start of data fields
3116  /**
3117  Intrusive list pointer for free list. If not null, points to the next
3118  Item on some Query_arena's free list. For instance, stored procedures
3119  have their own Query_arena's.
3120 
3121  @see Query_arena::free_list
3122  */
3123  Item *next_free;
3124 
3125  protected:
3126  /// str_values's main purpose is to cache the value in save_in_field
3127  String str_value;
3128 
3129  public:
3130  /**
3131  Character set and collation properties assigned for this Item.
3132  Used if Item represents a character string expression.
3133  */
3134  DTCollation collation;
3135  Item_name_string item_name; ///< Name from query
3136  Item_name_string orig_name; ///< Original item name (if it was renamed)
3137  /**
3138  Maximum length of result of evaluating this item, in number of bytes.
3139  - For character or blob data types, max char length multiplied by max
3140  character size (collation.mbmaxlen).
3141  - For decimal type, it is the precision in digits plus sign (unless
3142  unsigned) plus decimal point (unless it has zero decimals).
3143  - For other numeric types, the default or specific display length.
3144  - For date/time types, the display length (10 for DATE, 10 + optional FSP
3145  for TIME, 19 + optional fsp for datetime/timestamp).
3146  - For bit, the number of bits.
3147  - For enum, the string length of the widest enum element.
3148  - For set, the sum of the string length of each set element plus separators.
3149  - For geometry, the maximum size of a BLOB (it's underlying storage type).
3150  - For json, the maximum size of a BLOB (it's underlying storage type).
3151  */
3152  uint32 max_length; ///< Maximum length, in bytes
3153  enum item_marker ///< Values for member 'marker'
3154  { MARKER_NONE = 0,
3155  /// When contextualization or itemization adds an implicit comparison '0<>'
3156  /// (see make_condition()), to record that this Item_func_ne was created for
3157  /// this purpose; this value is tested during resolution.
3158  MARKER_IMPLICIT_NE_ZERO = 1,
3159  /// When doing constant propagation (e.g. change_cond_ref_to_const(), to
3160  /// remember that we have already processed the item.
3161  MARKER_CONST_PROPAG = 2,
3162  /// When creating an internal temporary table: says how to store BIT fields.
3163  MARKER_BIT = 4,
3164  /// When analyzing functional dependencies for only_full_group_by (says
3165  /// whether a nullable column can be treated at not nullable).
3166  MARKER_FUNC_DEP_NOT_NULL = 5,
3167  /// When we change DISTINCT to GROUP BY: used for book-keeping of
3168  /// fields.
3169  MARKER_DISTINCT_GROUP = 6,
3170  /// When pushing conditions down to derived table: it says a condition
3171  /// contains only derived table's columns.
3172  MARKER_COND_DERIVED_TABLE = 7,
3173  /// When pushing index conditions: it says whether a condition uses only
3174  /// indexed columns.
3175  MARKER_ICP_COND_USES_INDEX_ONLY = 10 };
3176  /**
3177  This member has several successive meanings, depending on the phase we're
3178  in (@see item_marker).
3179  The important property is that a phase must have a value (or few values)
3180  which is reserved for this phase. If it wants to set "marked", it assigns
3181  the value; it it wants to test if it is marked, it tests marker !=
3182  value. If the value has been assigned and the phase wants to cancel it can
3183  set marker to MARKER_NONE, which is a magic number which no phase
3184  reserves.
3185  A phase can expect 'marker' to be MARKER_NONE at the start of execution of
3186  a normal statement, at the start of preparation of a PS, and at the start
3187  of execution of a PS.
3188  A phase should not expect marker's value to survive after the phase's
3189  end - as a following phase may change it.
3190  */
3191  item_marker marker;
3192  Item_result cmp_context; ///< Comparison context
3193  private:
3194  const bool is_parser_item; ///< true if allocated directly by parser
3195  int8 is_expensive_cache; ///< Cache of result of is_expensive()
3196  uint8 m_data_type; ///< Data type assigned to Item
3197  public:
3198  bool fixed; ///< True if item has been resolved
3199  /**
3200  Number of decimals in result when evaluating this item
3201  - For integer type, always zero.
3202  - For decimal type, number of decimals.
3203  - For float type, it may be DECIMAL_NOT_SPECIFIED
3204  - For time, datetime and timestamp, number of decimals in fractional second
3205  - For string types, may be decimals of cast source or DECIMAL_NOT_SPECIFIED
3206  */
3207  uint8 decimals;
3208  /**
3209  True if this item may be null.
3210 
3211  For items that represent rows, it is true if one of the columns
3212  may be null.
3213 
3214  For items that represent scalar or row subqueries, it is true if
3215  one of the returned columns could be null, or if the subquery
3216  could return zero rows.
3217 
3218  It is worth noting that this information is correct only until
3219  equality propagation has been run by the optimization phase.
3220  Indeed, consider:
3221  select * from t1, t2,t3 where t1.pk=t2.a and t1.pk+1...
3222  the '+' is not nullable as t1.pk is not nullable;
3223  but if the optimizer chooses plan is t2-t3-t1, then, due to equality
3224  propagation it will replace t1.pk in '+' with t2.a (as t2 is before t1
3225  in plan), making the '+' capable of returning NULL when t2.a is NULL.
3226  */
3227  bool maybe_null;
3228  bool null_value; ///< True if item is null
3229  bool unsigned_flag;
3230  bool m_is_window_function; ///< True if item represents window func
3231  /**
3232  If the item is in a SELECT list (SELECT_LEX::fields) and hidden is true,
3233  the item wasn't actually in the list as given by the user (it was added
3234  by the optimizer, to e.g. make sure it was part of a given
3235  materialization), and should not be returned in the actual result.
3236 
3237  If the item is not in a SELECT list, the value is irrelevant.
3238  */
3239  bool hidden{false};
3240  /**
3241  True if item is a top most element in the expression being
3242  evaluated for a check constraint.
3243  */
3244  bool m_in_check_constraint_exec_ctx{false};
3245 
3246  private:
3247  /**
3248  True if this is an expression from the select list of a derived table
3249  which is actually used by outer query.
3250  */
3251  bool derived_used;
3252 
3253  protected:
3254  /**
3255  Set of properties that are calculated by accumulation from underlying items.
3256  Computed by constructors and fix_fields() and updated by
3257  update_used_tables(). The properties are accumulated up to the root of the
3258  current item tree, except they are not accumulated across subqueries and
3259  functions.
3260  */
3261  static constexpr uint8 PROP_SUBQUERY = 0x01;
3262  static constexpr uint8 PROP_STORED_PROGRAM = 0x02;
3263  static constexpr uint8 PROP_AGGREGATION = 0x04;
3264  static constexpr uint8 PROP_WINDOW_FUNCTION = 0x08;
3265  /**
3266  Set if the item or one or more of the underlying items contains a
3267  ROLLUP expression. The rolled up expression itself is not so marked.
3268  */
3269  static constexpr uint8 PROP_ROLLUP_EXPR = 0x10;
3270  /**
3271  Set if the item or one or more of the underlying items is a GROUPING
3272  function.
3273  */
3274  static constexpr uint8 PROP_GROUPING_FUNC = 0x20;
3275  uint8 m_accum_properties;
3276 
3277  public:
3278  /**
3279  Noop in Item for items that are not subclasses of Item_ident.
3280  Overridden in Item_ident where it sets the
3281  table_name member. Signture matches the requirement of
3282  Item::walk.
3283 
3284  @return true - to signal that walk should continue to sub items.
3285  */
3286  virtual bool set_table_name(uchar *) { return true; }
3287 
3288  /**
3289  Check if this expression can be used for partial update of a given
3290  JSON column.
3291 
3292  For example, the expression `JSON_REPLACE(col, '$.foo', 'bar')`
3293  can be used to partially update the column `foo`.
3294 
3295  @param field the JSON column that is being updated
3296  @return true if this expression can be used for partial update,
3297  false otherwise
3298  */
3299  virtual bool supports_partial_update(
3300  const Field_json *field MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) const {
3301  return false;
3302  }
3303 
3304  /**
3305  Whether the item returns array of its data type
3306  */
3307  virtual bool returns_array() const { return false; }
3308 
3309  /**
3310  A helper funciton to ensure proper usage of CAST(.. AS .. ARRAY)
3311  */
3312  virtual void allow_array_cast() {}
3313 };
3314 
3315 /**
3316  Descriptor of what and how to cache for
3317  Item::cache_const_expr_transformer/analyzer.
3318 
3319 */
3320 
3321 struct cache_const_expr_arg {
3322  /// Path from the expression's top to the current item in item tree
3323  /// used to track parent of current item for caching JSON data
3324  List<Item> stack;
3325  /// Item to cache. Used as a binary flag, but kept as Item* for assertion
3326  Item *cache_item{nullptr};
3327  /// How to cache JSON data. @see Item::enum_const_item_cache
3328  Item::enum_const_item_cache cache_arg{Item::CACHE_NONE};
3329 };
3330 
3331 /**
3332  A helper class to give in a functor to Item::walk(). Use as e.g.:
3333 
3334  bool result = WalkItem(root_item, enum_walk::POSTFIX, [](Item *item) { ... });
3335 
3336  TODO: Make Item::walk() just take in a functor in the first place, instead of
3337  a pointer-to-member and an opaque argument.
3338  */
3339 template <class T>
3340 inline bool WalkItem(Item *item, enum_walk walk, T &&functor) {
3341  return item->walk(&Item::walk_helper_thunk<T>, walk,
3342  reinterpret_cast<uchar *>(&functor));
3343 }
3344 
3345 class sp_head;
3346 
3347 class Item_basic_constant : public Item {
3348  table_map used_table_map;
3349 
3350  public:
3351  Item_basic_constant() : Item(), used_table_map(0) {}
3352  explicit Item_basic_constant(const POS &pos) : Item(pos), used_table_map(0) {}
3353 
3354  /// @todo add implementation of basic_const_item
3355  /// and remove from subclasses as appropriate.
3356 
3357  void set_used_tables(table_map map) { used_table_map = map; }
3358  table_map used_tables() const override { return used_table_map; }
3359  bool check_function_as_value_generator(uchar *) override { return false; }
3360  /* to prevent drop fixed flag (no need parent cleanup call) */
3361  void cleanup() override {
3362  // @todo We should ensure we never change "basic constant" nodes.
3363  // We should then be able to add this assert:
3364  // DBUG_ASSERT(marker == MARKER_NONE);
3365  // and remove the call to Item::cleanup()
3366  Item::cleanup();
3367  }
3368  bool basic_const_item() const override { return true; }
3369  void set_str_value(String *str) { str_value = *str; }
3370 };
3371 
3372 /*****************************************************************************
3373  The class is a base class for representation of stored routine variables in
3374  the Item-hierarchy. There are the following kinds of SP-vars:
3375  - local variables (Item_splocal);
3376  - CASE expression (Item_case_expr);
3377 *****************************************************************************/
3378 
3379 class Item_sp_variable : public Item {
3380  protected:
3381  /*
3382  THD, which is stored in fix_fields() and is used in this_item() to avoid
3383  current_thd use.
3384  */
3385  THD *m_thd;
3386 
3387  public:
3388  Name_string m_name;
3389 
3390  public:
3391 #ifndef DBUG_OFF
3392  /*
3393  Routine to which this Item_splocal belongs. Used for checking if correct
3394  runtime context is used for variable handling.
3395  */
3396  sp_head *m_sp;
3397 #endif
3398 
3399  public:
3400  Item_sp_variable(const Name_string sp_var_name);
3401 
3402  table_map used_tables() const override { return INNER_TABLE_BIT; }
3403  bool fix_fields(THD *thd, Item **) override;
3404 
3405  double val_real() override;
3406  longlong val_int() override;
3407  String *val_str(String *sp) override;
3408  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *decimal_value) override;
3409  bool val_json(Json_wrapper *result) override;
3410  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override;
3411  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override;
3412  bool is_null() override;
3413 
3414  public:
3415  inline void make_field(Send_field *field) override;
3416  bool send(Protocol *protocol, String *str) override {
3417  // Need to override send() in case this_item() is an Item_field with a
3418  // ZEROFILL attribute.
3419  return this_item()->send(protocol, str);
3420  }
3421  bool check_column_from_derived_table(
3422  uchar *arg MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) override {
3423  // It is ok to push down a condition like "column > SP_variable"
3424  return false;
3425  }
3426 
3427  protected:
3428  inline type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(
3429  Field *field, bool no_conversions) override;
3430 };
3431 
3432 /*****************************************************************************
3433  Item_sp_variable inline implementation.
3434 *****************************************************************************/
3435 
3436 inline void Item_sp_variable::make_field(Send_field *field) {
3437  Item *it = this_item();
3438  it->item_name.copy(item_name.is_set() ? item_name : m_name);
3439  it->make_field(field);
3440 }
3441 
3442 inline type_conversion_status Item_sp_variable::save_in_field_inner(
3443  Field *field, bool no_conversions) {
3444  return this_item()->save_in_field(field, no_conversions);
3445 }
3446 
3447 /*****************************************************************************
3448  A reference to local SP variable (incl. reference to SP parameter), used in
3449  runtime.
3450 *****************************************************************************/
3451 
3452 class Item_splocal final : public Item_sp_variable,
3453  private Settable_routine_parameter {
3454  uint m_var_idx;
3455 
3456  Type m_type;
3457  Item_result m_result_type;
3458 
3459  public:
3460  /*
3461  If this variable is a parameter in LIMIT clause.
3462  Used only during NAME_CONST substitution, to not append
3463  NAME_CONST to the resulting query and thus not break
3464  the slave.
3465  */
3466  bool limit_clause_param;
3467  /*
3468  Position of this reference to SP variable in the statement (the
3469  statement itself is in sp_instr_stmt::m_query).
3470  This is valid only for references to SP variables in statements,
3471  excluding DECLARE CURSOR statement. It is used to replace references to SP
3472  variables with NAME_CONST calls when putting statements into the binary
3473  log.
3474  Value of 0 means that this object doesn't corresponding to reference to
3475  SP variable in query text.
3476  */
3477  uint pos_in_query;
3478  /*
3479  Byte length of SP variable name in the statement (see pos_in_query).
3480  The value of this field may differ from the name_length value because
3481  name_length contains byte length of UTF8-encoded item name, but
3482  the query string (see sp_instr_stmt::m_query) is currently stored with
3483  a charset from the SET NAMES statement.
3484  */
3485  uint len_in_query;
3486 
3487  Item_splocal(const Name_string sp_var_name, uint sp_var_idx,
3488  enum_field_types sp_var_type, uint pos_in_q = 0,
3489  uint len_in_q = 0);
3490 
3491  bool is_splocal() const override { return true; }
3492 
3493  Item *this_item() override;
3494  const Item *this_item() const override;
3495  Item **this_item_addr(THD *thd, Item **) override;
3496 
3497  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
3498  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
3499 
3500  public:
3501  inline uint get_var_idx() const { return m_var_idx; }
3502 
3503  inline enum Type type() const override { return m_type; }
3504  inline Item_result result_type() const override { return m_result_type; }
3505  bool val_json(Json_wrapper *result) override;
3506 
3507  private:
3508  bool set_value(THD *thd, sp_rcontext *ctx, Item **it) override;
3509 
3510  public:
3511  Settable_routine_parameter *get_settable_routine_parameter() override {
3512  return this;
3513  }
3514 };
3515 
3516 /*****************************************************************************
3517  A reference to case expression in SP, used in runtime.
3518 *****************************************************************************/
3519 
3520 class Item_case_expr final : public Item_sp_variable {
3521  public:
3522  Item_case_expr(uint case_expr_id);
3523 
3524  public:
3525  Item *this_item() override;
3526  const Item *this_item() const override;
3527  Item **this_item_addr(THD *thd, Item **) override;
3528 
3529  Type type() const override { return this_item()->type(); }
3530  Item_result result_type() const override {
3531  return this_item()->result_type();
3532  }
3533  /*
3534  NOTE: print() is intended to be used from views and for debug.
3535  Item_case_expr can not occur in views, so here it is only for debug
3536  purposes.
3537  */
3538  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
3539  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
3540 
3541  private:
3542  uint m_case_expr_id;
3543 };
3544 
3545 /*
3546  NAME_CONST(given_name, const_value).
3547  This 'function' has all properties of the supplied const_value (which is
3548  assumed to be a literal constant), and the name given_name.
3549 
3550  This is used to replace references to SP variables when we write PROCEDURE
3551  statements into the binary log.
3552 
3553  TODO
3554  Together with Item_splocal and Item::this_item() we can actually extract
3555  common a base of this class and Item_splocal. Maybe it is possible to
3556  extract a common base with class Item_ref, too.
3557 */
3558 
3559 class Item_name_const final : public Item {
3560  typedef Item super;
3561 
3562  Item *value_item;
3563  Item *name_item;
3564  bool valid_args;
3565 
3566  public:
3567  Item_name_const(const POS &pos, Item *name_arg, Item *val);
3568 
3569  bool itemize(Parse_context *pc, Item **res) override;
3570  bool fix_fields(THD *, Item **) override;
3571 
3572  enum Type type() const override;
3573  double val_real() override;
3574  longlong val_int() override;
3575  String *val_str(String *sp) override;
3576  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
3577  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override;
3578  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override;
3579  bool is_null() override;
3580  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
3581  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
3582 
3583  Item_result result_type() const override { return value_item->result_type(); }
3584 
3585  bool cache_const_expr_analyzer(uchar **) override {
3586  // Item_name_const always wraps a literal, so there is no need to cache it.
3587  return false;
3588  }
3589 
3590  protected:
3591  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
3592  bool no_conversions) override {
3593  return value_item->save_in_field(field, no_conversions);
3594  }
3595 };
3596 
3597 bool agg_item_collations_for_comparison(DTCollation &c, const char *name,
3598  Item **items, uint nitems, uint flags);
3599 bool agg_item_set_converter(DTCollation &coll, const char *fname, Item **args,
3600  uint nargs, uint flags, int item_sep);
3601 bool agg_item_charsets(DTCollation &c, const char *name, Item **items,
3602  uint nitems, uint flags, int item_sep);
3603 inline bool agg_item_charsets_for_string_result(DTCollation &c,
3604  const char *name, Item **items,
3605  uint nitems, int item_sep = 1) {
3606  uint flags = MY_COLL_ALLOW_SUPERSET_CONV | MY_COLL_ALLOW_COERCIBLE_CONV |
3607  MY_COLL_ALLOW_NUMERIC_CONV;
3608  return agg_item_charsets(c, name, items, nitems, flags, item_sep);
3609 }
3610 inline bool agg_item_charsets_for_comparison(DTCollation &c, const char *name,
3611  Item **items, uint nitems,
3612  int item_sep = 1) {
3613  uint flags = MY_COLL_ALLOW_SUPERSET_CONV | MY_COLL_ALLOW_COERCIBLE_CONV |
3614  MY_COLL_DISALLOW_NONE;
3615  return agg_item_charsets(c, name, items, nitems, flags, item_sep);
3616 }
3617 
3618 class Item_num : public Item_basic_constant {
3619  typedef Item_basic_constant super;
3620 
3621  public:
3622  Item_num() { collation.set_numeric(); }
3623  explicit Item_num(const POS &pos) : super(pos) { collation.set_numeric(); }
3624 
3625  virtual Item_num *neg() = 0;
3626  Item *safe_charset_converter(THD *thd, const CHARSET_INFO *tocs) override;
3627  bool check_partition_func_processor(uchar *) override { return false; }
3628 };
3629 
3630 #define NO_FIELD_INDEX ((uint16)(-1))
3631 
3632 class Item_ident : public Item {
3633  typedef Item super;
3634 
3635  protected:
3636  /**
3637  The fields m_orig_db_name, m_orig_table_name and m_orig_field_name are
3638  maintained so that we can provide information about the origin of a
3639  column that may have been renamed within the query, e.g. as required by
3640  connectors.
3641 
3642  Names the original schema of the table that is the source of the field.
3643  If field is from
3644  - a non-aliased base table, the same as db_name.
3645  - an aliased base table, the name of the schema of the base table.
3646  - an expression (including aggregation), a NULL pointer.
3647  - a derived table, the name of the schema of the underlying base table.
3648  - a view, the name of the schema of the underlying base table.
3649  - a temporary table (in optimization stage), the name of the schema of
3650  the source base table.
3651  */
3652  const char *m_orig_db_name;
3653  /**
3654  Names the original table that is the source of the field. If field is from
3655  - a non-aliased base table, the same as table_name.
3656  - an aliased base table, the name of the base table.
3657  - an expression (including aggregation), a NULL pointer.
3658  - a derived table, the name of the underlying base table.
3659  - a view, the name of the underlying base table.
3660  - a temporary table (in optimization stage), the name of the source base tbl
3661  */
3662  const char *m_orig_table_name;
3663  /**
3664  Names the field in the source base table. If field is from
3665  - an expression, a NULL pointer.
3666  - a view or base table and is not aliased, the same as field_name.
3667  - a view or base table and is aliased, the column name of the view or
3668  base table.
3669  - a derived table, the column name of the underlying base table.
3670  - a temporary table (in optimization stage), the name of the source column.
3671  */
3672  const char *m_orig_field_name;
3673  bool m_alias_of_expr; ///< if this Item's name is alias of SELECT expression
3674 
3675  public:
3676  /**
3677  For regularly resolved column references, 'context' points to a name
3678  resolution context object belonging to the query block which simply
3679  contains the reference. To further clarify, in
3680  SELECT (SELECT t.a) FROM t;
3681  t.a is an Item_ident whose 'context' belongs to the subquery
3682  (context->select_lex == that of the subquery).
3683  For column references that are part of a generated column expression,
3684  'context' points to a temporary name resolution context object during
3685  resolving, but is set to nullptr after resolving is done. Note that
3686  Item_ident::local_column() depends on that.
3687  */
3688  Name_resolution_context *context;
3689  /**
3690  Schema name of the base table or view the column is part of.
3691  If an expression, a NULL pointer.
3692  If from a derived table, a NULL pointer.
3693  */
3694  const char *db_name;
3695  /**
3696  If column is from a non-aliased base table or view, name of base table or
3697  view.
3698  If column is from an aliased base table or view, the alias name.
3699  If column is from a derived table, the name of the derived table.
3700  If column is from an expression, a NULL pointer.
3701  */
3702  const char *table_name;
3703  /**
3704  If column is aliased, the column alias name.
3705  If column is from a non-aliased base table or view, the name of the
3706  column in that base table or view.
3707  If column is from an expression, a string generated from that expression.
3708  */
3709  const char *field_name;
3710 
3711  /*
3712  Cached pointer to table which contains this field, used for the same reason
3713  by prep. stmt. too in case then we have not-fully qualified field.
3714  0 - means no cached value.
3715  @todo Notice that this is usually the same as Item_field::table_ref.
3716  cached_table should be replaced by table_ref ASAP.
3717  */
3718  TABLE_LIST *cached_table;
3719  SELECT_LEX *depended_from;
3720 
3721  Item_ident(Name_resolution_context *context_arg, const char *db_name_arg,
3722  const char *table_name_arg, const char *field_name_arg)
3723  : m_orig_db_name(db_name_arg),
3724  m_orig_table_name(table_name_arg),
3725  m_orig_field_name(field_name_arg),
3726  m_alias_of_expr(false),
3727  context(context_arg),
3728  db_name(db_name_arg),
3729  table_name(table_name_arg),
3730  field_name(field_name_arg),
3731  cached_table(nullptr),
3732  depended_from(nullptr) {
3733  item_name.set(field_name_arg);
3734  }
3735 
3736  Item_ident(const POS &pos, const char *db_name_arg,
3737  const char *table_name_arg, const char *field_name_arg)
3738  : super(pos),
3739  m_orig_db_name(db_name_arg),
3740  m_orig_table_name(table_name_arg),
3741  m_orig_field_name(field_name_arg),
3742  m_alias_of_expr(false),
3743  db_name(db_name_arg),
3744  table_name(table_name_arg),
3745  field_name(field_name_arg),
3746  cached_table(nullptr),
3747  depended_from(nullptr) {
3748  item_name.set(field_name_arg);
3749  }
3750 
3751  /// Constructor used by Item_field & Item_*_ref (see Item comment)
3752 
3753  Item_ident(THD *thd, Item_ident *item)
3754  : Item(thd, item),
3755  m_orig_db_name(item->m_orig_db_name),
3756  m_orig_table_name(item->m_orig_table_name),
3757  m_orig_field_name(item->m_orig_field_name),
3758  m_alias_of_expr(item->m_alias_of_expr),
3759  context(item->context),
3760  db_name(item->db_name),
3761  table_name(item->table_name),
3762  field_name(item->field_name),
3763  cached_table(item->cached_table),
3764  depended_from(item->depended_from) {}
3765 
3766  bool itemize(Parse_context *pc, Item **res) override;
3767 
3768  const char *full_name() const override;
3769  void set_orig_db_name(const char *name_arg) { m_orig_db_name = name_arg; }
3770  void set_orig_table_name(const char *name_arg) {
3771  m_orig_table_name = name_arg;
3772  }
3773  void set_orig_field_name(const char *name_arg) {
3774  m_orig_field_name = name_arg;
3775  }
3776  const char *orig_db_name() const { return m_orig_db_name; }
3777  const char *orig_table_name() const { return m_orig_table_name; }
3778  void fix_after_pullout(SELECT_LEX *parent_select,
3779  SELECT_LEX *removed_select) override;
3780  bool aggregate_check_distinct(uchar *arg) override;
3781  bool aggregate_check_group(uchar *arg) override;
3782  Bool3 local_column(const SELECT_LEX *sl) const override;
3783 
3784  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
3785  enum_query_type query_type) const override {
3786  print(thd, str, query_type, db_name, table_name);
3787  }
3788 
3789  /**
3790  Assign the argument to table_name. Argument passed as uchar* to
3791  match requirement of Item::walk.
3792 
3793  @param tn new table_name (should be pointer to const char)
3794  @return true - to signal that walk should continue to sub items.
3795  */
3796  bool set_table_name(uchar *tn) final {
3797  table_name = pointer_cast<const char *>(tn);
3798  return true;
3799  }
3800 
3801  protected:
3802  /**
3803  Function to print column name for a table
3804 
3805  To print a column for a permanent table (picks up database and table from
3806  Item_ident object):
3807 
3808  item->print(str, qt)
3809 
3810  To print a column for a temporary table:
3811 
3812  item->print(str, qt, specific_db, specific_table)
3813 
3814  Items of temporary table fields have empty/NULL values of table_name and
3815  db_name. To print column names in a 3D form (`database`.`table`.`column`),
3816  this function prints db_name_arg and table_name_arg parameters instead of
3817  this->db_name and this->table_name respectively.
3818 
3819  @param thd Thread handle.
3820  @param [out] str Output string buffer.
3821  @param query_type Bitmap to control printing details.
3822  @param db_name_arg String to output as a column database name.
3823  @param table_name_arg String to output as a column table name.
3824  */
3825  void print(const THD *thd, String *str, enum_query_type query_type,
3826  const char *db_name_arg, const char *table_name_arg) const;
3827 
3828  public:
3829  ///< Argument object to change_context_processor
3830  struct Change_context {
3831  Name_resolution_context *m_context;
3832  Change_context(Name_resolution_context *context) : m_context(context) {}
3833  };
3834  bool change_context_processor(uchar *arg) override {
3835  context = reinterpret_cast<Change_context *>(arg)->m_context;
3836  return false;
3837  }
3838 
3839  /// @returns true if this Item's name is alias of SELECT expression
3840  bool is_alias_of_expr() const { return m_alias_of_expr; }
3841  /// Marks that this Item's name is alias of SELECT expression
3842  void set_alias_of_expr() { m_alias_of_expr = true; }
3843 
3844  bool walk(Item_processor processor, enum_walk walk, uchar *arg) override {
3845  /*
3846  Item_ident processors like aggregate_check*() use
3847  enum_walk::PREFIX|enum_walk::POSTFIX and depend on the processor being
3848  called twice then.
3849  */
3850  return ((walk & enum_walk::PREFIX) && (this->*processor)(arg)) ||
3851  ((walk & enum_walk::POSTFIX) && (this->*processor)(arg));
3852  }
3853 
3854  /**
3855  Argument structure for walk processor Item::update_depended_from
3856  */
3857  struct Depended_change {
3858  SELECT_LEX *old_depended_from; // the transformed query block
3859  SELECT_LEX *new_depended_from; // the new derived table for grouping
3860  };
3861 
3862  bool update_depended_from(uchar *) override;
3863 
3864  /**
3865  @returns true if a part of this Item's full name (name or table name) is
3866  an alias.
3867  */
3868  virtual bool alias_name_used() const { return m_alias_of_expr; }
3869  friend bool insert_fields(THD *thd, Name_resolution_context *context,
3870  const char *db_name, const char *table_name,
3871  mem_root_deque<Item *>::iterator *it,
3872  bool any_privileges);
3873  bool is_strong_side_column_not_in_fd(uchar *arg) override;
3874  bool is_column_not_in_fd(uchar *arg) override;
3875 };
3876 
3877 class Item_ident_for_show final : public Item {
3878  public:
3879  Field *field;
3880  const char *db_name;
3881  const char *table_name;
3882 
3883  Item_ident_for_show(Field *par_field, const char *db_arg,
3884  const char *table_name_arg)
3885  : field(par_field), db_name(db_arg), table_name(table_name_arg) {}
3886 
3887  enum Type type() const override { return FIELD_ITEM; }
3888  bool fix_fields(THD *thd, Item **ref) override;
3889  double val_real() override { return field->val_real(); }
3890  longlong val_int() override { return field->val_int(); }
3891  String *val_str(String *str) override { return field->val_str(str); }
3892  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *dec) override {
3893  return field->val_decimal(dec);
3894  }
3895  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override {
3896  return field->get_date(ltime, fuzzydate);
3897  }
3898  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override { return field->get_time(ltime); }
3899  void make_field(Send_field *tmp_field) override;
3900  const CHARSET_INFO *charset_for_protocol() override {
3901  return field->charset_for_protocol();
3902  }
3903 };
3904 
3905 class COND_EQUAL;
3906 class Item_equal;
3907 
3908 class Item_field : public Item_ident {
3909  typedef Item_ident super;
3910 
3911  protected:
3912  void set_field(Field *field);
3913  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
3914  bool no_conversions) override;
3915 
3916  public:
3917  /**
3918  Table containing this resolved field. This is required e.g for calculation
3919  of table map. Notice that for the following types of "tables",
3920  no TABLE_LIST object is assigned and hence table_ref is NULL:
3921  - Temporary tables assigned by join optimizer for sorting and aggregation.
3922  - Stored procedure dummy tables.
3923  For fields referencing such tables, table number is always 0, and other
3924  uses of table_ref is not needed.
3925  */
3926  TABLE_LIST *table_ref;
3927  /// Source field
3928  Field *field;
3929 
3930  private:
3931  /// Result field
3932  Field *result_field{nullptr};
3933 
3934  /**
3935  If this field is derived from another field, e.g. it is reading a column
3936  from a temporary table which is populated from a base table, this member
3937  points to the field used to populate the temporary table column.
3938  */
3939  const Item_field *m_base_item_field{nullptr};
3940 
3941  public:
3942  /**
3943  Used during optimization to perform multiple equality analysis,
3944  this analysis should be performed during preparation instead, so that
3945  Item_field can be const after preparation.
3946  */
3947  Item_equal *item_equal{nullptr};
3948  /**
3949  Index for this field in table->field array. Holds NO_FIELD_INDEX
3950  if index value is not known.
3951  */
3952  uint16 field_index;
3953 
3954  void set_item_equal(Item_equal *item_equal_arg) {
3955  if (item_equal == nullptr && item_equal_arg != nullptr) {
3956  item_equal = item_equal_arg;
3957  }
3958  }
3959 
3960  void set_item_equal_all_join_nests(Item_equal *item_equal) {
3961  if (item_equal != nullptr) {
3962  item_equal_all_join_nests = item_equal;
3963  }
3964  }
3965 
3966  // A list of fields that are considered "equal" to this field. E.g., a query
3967  // on the form "a JOIN b ON a.i = b.i JOIN c ON b.i = c.i" would consider
3968  // a.i, b.i and c.i equal due to equality propagation. This is the same as
3969  // "item_equal" above, except that "item_equal" will only contain fields from
3970  // the same join nest. This is used by hash join and BKA when they need to
3971  // undo multi-equality propagation done by the optimizer. (The optimizer may
3972  // generate join conditions that references unreachable fields for said
3973  // iterators.) The split is done because NDB expects the list to only
3974  // contain fields from the same join nest.
3975  Item_equal *item_equal_all_join_nests{nullptr};
3976  /// If true, the optimizer's constant propagation will not replace this item
3977  /// with an equal constant.
3978  bool no_constant_propagation{false};
3979  /*
3980  if any_privileges set to true then here real effective privileges will
3981  be stored
3982  */
3983  uint have_privileges;
3984  /* field need any privileges (for VIEW creation) */
3985  bool any_privileges;
3986  /*
3987  if this field is used in a context where covering prefix keys
3988  are supported.
3989  */
3990  bool can_use_prefix_key{false};
3991 
3992  Item_field(Name_resolution_context *context_arg, const char *db_arg,
3993  const char *table_name_arg, const char *field_name_arg);
3994  Item_field(const POS &pos, const char *db_arg, const char *table_name_arg,
3995  const char *field_name_arg);
3996  Item_field(THD *thd, Item_field *item);
3997  Item_field(THD *thd, Name_resolution_context *context_arg, TABLE_LIST *tr,
3998  Field *field);
3999  Item_field(Field *field);
4000 
4001  bool itemize(Parse_context *pc, Item **res) override;
4002 
4003  enum Type type() const override { return FIELD_ITEM; }
4004  bool eq(const Item *item, bool binary_cmp) const override;
4005  double val_real() override;
4006  longlong val_int() override;
4007  longlong val_time_temporal() override;
4008  longlong val_date_temporal() override;
4009  longlong val_time_temporal_at_utc() override;
4010  longlong val_date_temporal_at_utc() override;
4011  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
4012  String *val_str(String *) override;
4013  bool val_json(Json_wrapper *result) override;
4014  bool send(Protocol *protocol, String *str_arg) override;
4015  void reset_field(Field *f);
4016  bool fix_fields(THD *, Item **) override;
4017  void make_field(Send_field *tmp_field) override;
4018  void save_org_in_field(Field *field) override;
4019  table_map used_tables() const override;
4020  Item_result result_type() const override { return field->result_type(); }
4021  Item_result numeric_context_result_type() const override {
4022  return field->numeric_context_result_type();
4023  }
4024  Item_result cast_to_int_type() const override {
4025  return field->cast_to_int_type();
4026  }
4027  enum_monotonicity_info get_monotonicity_info() const override {
4028  return MONOTONIC_STRICT_INCREASING;
4029  }
4030  longlong val_int_endpoint(bool left_endp, bool *incl_endp) override;
4031  void set_result_field(Field *field_arg) override { result_field = field_arg; }
4032  Field *get_tmp_table_field() override { return result_field; }
4033  Field *tmp_table_field(TABLE *) override { return result_field; }
4034  void set_base_item_field(const Item_field *item) {
4035  m_base_item_field =
4036  item->base_item_field() != nullptr ? item->base_item_field() : item;
4037  }
4038  const Item_field *base_item_field() const {
4039  return m_base_item_field ? m_base_item_field : this;
4040  }
4041  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override;
4042  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override;
4043  bool get_timeval(struct timeval *tm, int *warnings) override;
4044  bool is_null() override {
4045  // NOTE: May return true even if maybe_null is not set!
4046  // This can happen if the underlying TABLE did not have a NULL row
4047  // at set_field() time (ie., table->is_null_row() was false),
4048  // but does now.
4049  return field->is_null();
4050  }
4051  Item *get_tmp_table_item(THD *thd) override;
4052  bool collect_item_field_processor(uchar *arg) override;
4053  bool collect_item_field_or_view_ref_processor(uchar *arg) override;
4054  bool add_field_to_set_processor(uchar *arg) override;
4055  bool add_field_to_cond_set_processor(uchar *) override;
4056  bool remove_column_from_bitmap(uchar *arg) override;
4057  bool find_item_in_field_list_processor(uchar *arg) override;
4058  bool find_field_processor(uchar *arg) override {
4059  return pointer_cast<Field *>(arg) == field;
4060  }
4061  bool check_function_as_value_generator(uchar *args) override;
4062  bool mark_field_in_map(uchar *arg) override {
4063  auto mark_field = pointer_cast<Mark_field *>(arg);
4064  bool rc = Item::mark_field_in_map(mark_field, field);
4065  if (result_field && result_field != field)
4066  rc |= Item::mark_field_in_map(mark_field, result_field);
4067  return rc;
4068  }
4069  bool used_tables_for_level(uchar *arg) override;
4070  bool check_column_privileges(uchar *arg) override;
4071  bool check_partition_func_processor(uchar *) override { return false; }
4072  void bind_fields() override;
4073  bool check_column_from_derived_table(uchar *arg) override;
4074  bool check_column_in_window_functions(uchar *arg) override;
4075  bool check_column_in_group_by(uchar *arg) override;
4076  Item *replace_with_derived_expr(uchar *arg) override;
4077  Item *replace_with_derived_expr_ref(uchar *arg) override;
4078  void cleanup() override;
4079  void reset_field();
4080  Item_equal *find_item_equal(COND_EQUAL *cond_equal) const;
4081  bool subst_argument_checker(uchar **arg) override;
4082  Item *equal_fields_propagator(uchar *arg) override;
4083  Item *replace_item_field(uchar *) override;
4084  bool disable_constant_propagation(uchar *) override {
4085  no_constant_propagation = true;
4086  return false;
4087  }
4088  Item *replace_equal_field(uchar *) override;
4089  inline uint32 max_disp_length() { return field->max_display_length(); }
4090  Item_field *field_for_view_update() override { return this; }
4091  Item *safe_charset_converter(THD *thd, const CHARSET_INFO *tocs) override;
4092  int fix_outer_field(THD *thd, Field **field, Item **reference);
4093  Item *update_value_transformer(uchar *select_arg) override;
4094  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
4095  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
4096  bool is_outer_field() const override {
4097  DBUG_ASSERT(fixed);
4098  return table_ref->outer_join || table_ref->outer_join_nest();
4099  }
4100  Field::geometry_type get_geometry_type() const override {
4101  DBUG_ASSERT(data_type() == MYSQL_TYPE_GEOMETRY);
4102  return field->get_geometry_type();
4103  }
4104  const CHARSET_INFO *charset_for_protocol(void) override {
4105  return field->charset_for_protocol();
4106  }
4107 
4108 #ifndef DBUG_OFF
4109  void dbug_print() const {
4110  fprintf(DBUG_FILE, "<field ");
4111  if (field) {
4112  fprintf(DBUG_FILE, "'%s.%s': ", field->table->alias, field->field_name);
4113  field->dbug_print();
4114  } else
4115  fprintf(DBUG_FILE, "NULL");
4116 
4117  fprintf(DBUG_FILE, ", result_field: ");
4118  if (result_field) {
4119  fprintf(DBUG_FILE, "'%s.%s': ", result_field->table->alias,
4120  result_field->field_name);
4121  result_field->dbug_print();
4122  } else
4123  fprintf(DBUG_FILE, "NULL");
4124  fprintf(DBUG_FILE, ">\n");
4125  }
4126 #endif
4127 
4128  float get_filtering_effect(THD *thd, table_map filter_for_table,
4129  table_map read_tables,
4130  const MY_BITMAP *fields_to_ignore,
4131  double rows_in_table) override;
4132 
4133  /**
4134  Returns the probability for the predicate "col OP <val>" to be
4135  true for a row in the case where no index statistics or range
4136  estimates are available for 'col'.
4137 
4138  The probability depends on the number of rows in the table: it is by
4139  default 'default_filter', but never lower than 1/max_distinct_values
4140  (e.g. number of rows in the table, or the number of distinct values
4141  possible for the datatype if the field provides that kind of
4142  information).
4143 
4144  @param max_distinct_values The maximum number of distinct values,
4145  typically the number of rows in the table
4146  @param default_filter The default filter for the predicate
4147 
4148  @return the estimated filtering effect for this predicate
4149  */
4150 
4151  float get_cond_filter_default_probability(double max_distinct_values,
4152  float default_filter) const;
4153 
4154  /**
4155  @note that field->table->alias_name_used is reliable only if
4156  thd->lex->need_correct_ident() is true.
4157  */
4158  bool alias_name_used() const override {
4159  return m_alias_of_expr ||
4160  // maybe the qualifying table was given an alias ("t1 AS foo"):
4161  (field && field->table && field->table->alias_name_used);
4162  }
4163 
4164  bool repoint_const_outer_ref(uchar *arg) override;
4165  bool returns_array() const override { return field && field->is_array(); }
4166 
4167  void set_can_use_prefix_key() override { can_use_prefix_key = true; }
4168 
4169  bool replace_field_processor(uchar *arg) override;
4170  bool strip_db_table_name_processor(uchar *) override;
4171 
4172  /**
4173  Checks if the current object represents an asterisk select list item
4174 
4175  @returns false if a regular column reference, true if an asterisk
4176  select list item.
4177  */
4178  virtual bool is_asterisk() const { return false; }
4179 };
4180 
4181 /**
4182  Represents [schema.][table.]* in a select list
4183 
4184  Item_asterisk is used to insert placeholder objects for the special
4185  select list item * (asterisk) into AST.
4186  Those placeholder objects are to be substituted later with e.g. a list of real
4187  table columns by a resolver (@see setup_wild).
4188 
4189  @todo The parent class Item_field is redundant. Refactor setup_wild() to
4190  replace Item_field with a simpler one.
4191 */
4192 class Item_asterisk : public Item_field {
4193  typedef Item_field super;
4194 
4195  public:
4196  /**
4197  Constructor
4198 
4199  @param pos Location of the * (asterisk) lexeme.
4200  @param opt_schema_name Schema name or nullptr.
4201  @param opt_table_name Table name or nullptr.
4202  */
4203  Item_asterisk(const POS &pos, const char *opt_schema_name,
4204  const char *opt_table_name)
4205  : super(pos, opt_schema_name, opt_table_name, "*") {}
4206 
4207  bool itemize(Parse_context *pc, Item **res) override;
4208  bool fix_fields(THD *, Item **) override {
4209  DBUG_ASSERT(false); // should never happen: see setup_wild()
4210  return true;
4211  }
4212  bool is_asterisk() const override { return true; }
4213 };
4214 
4215 // See if the provided item points to a reachable field (one that belongs to a
4216 // table within 'reachable_tables'). If not, go through the list of 'equal'
4217 // items in the item and see if we have a field that is reachable. If any such
4218 // field is found, create a new Item_field that points to this reachable field
4219 // and return it. If the provided item is already reachable, or if we cannot
4220 // find a reachable field, return the provided item unchanged. This is used when
4221 // creating a hash join iterator, where the join condition may point to a
4222 // non-reachable field due to multi-equality propagation during optimization.
4223 // (Ideally, the optimizer should not set up such condition in the first place.
4224 // This is difficult, if not impossible, to accomplish, given that the plan
4225 // created by the optimizer does not map 100% to the iterator executor.) Note
4226 // that if the field is not reachable, and we cannot find a reachable field, we
4227 // provided field is returned unchanged. The effect is that the hash join will
4228 // degrade into a nested loop.
4229 Item_field *FindEqualField(Item_field *item_field, table_map reachable_tables);
4230 
4231 class Item_null : public Item_basic_constant {
4232  typedef Item_basic_constant super;
4233 
4234  void init() {
4235  maybe_null = true;
4236  null_value = true;
4237  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_NULL);
4238  max_length = 0;
4239  fixed = true;
4240  collation.set(&my_charset_bin, DERIVATION_IGNORABLE);
4241  }
4242 
4243  protected:
4244  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
4245  bool no_conversions) override;
4246 
4247  public:
4248  Item_null() {
4249  init();
4250  item_name = NAME_STRING("NULL");
4251  }
4252  explicit Item_null(const POS &pos) : super(pos) {
4253  init();
4254  item_name = NAME_STRING("NULL");
4255  }
4256 
4257  Item_null(const Name_string &name_par) {
4258  init();
4259  item_name = name_par;
4260  }
4261 
4262  enum Type type() const override { return NULL_ITEM; }
4263  bool eq(const Item *item, bool binary_cmp) const override;
4264  double val_real() override;
4265  longlong val_int() override;
4266  longlong val_time_temporal() override { return val_int(); }
4267  longlong val_date_temporal() override { return val_int(); }
4268  String *val_str(String *str) override;
4269  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
4270  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *, my_time_flags_t) override { return true; }
4271  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *) override { return true; }
4272  bool val_json(Json_wrapper *wr) override;
4273  bool send(Protocol *protocol, String *str) override;
4274  Item_result result_type() const override { return STRING_RESULT; }
4275  Item *clone_item() const override { return new Item_null(item_name); }
4276  bool is_null() override { return true; }
4277 
4278  void print(const THD *, String *str,
4279  enum_query_type query_type) const override {
4280  str->append(query_type == QT_NORMALIZED_FORMAT ? "?" : "NULL");
4281  }
4282 
4283  Item *safe_charset_converter(THD *thd, const CHARSET_INFO *tocs) override;
4284  bool check_partition_func_processor(uchar *) override { return false; }
4285 };
4286 
4287 /// Dynamic parameters used as placeholders ('?') inside prepared statements
4288 
4289 class Item_param final : public Item, private Settable_routine_parameter {
4290  typedef Item super;
4291 
4292  protected:
4293  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
4294  bool no_conversions) override;
4295 
4296  public:
4297  enum enum_item_param_state {
4298  NO_VALUE,
4299  NULL_VALUE,
4300  INT_VALUE,
4301  REAL_VALUE,
4302  STRING_VALUE,
4303  TIME_VALUE, ///< holds TIME, DATE, DATETIME
4304  LONG_DATA_VALUE,
4305  DECIMAL_VALUE
4306  };
4307 
4308  void set_param_state(enum enum_item_param_state state) {
