4309  m_param_state = state;
4310  }
4311 
4312  enum enum_item_param_state param_state() const { return m_param_state; }
4313 
4314  void mark_json_as_scalar() override { m_json_as_scalar = true; }
4315  bool json_as_scalar() const override { return m_json_as_scalar; }
4316 
4317  /*
4318  A buffer for string and long data values. Historically all allocated
4319  values returned from val_str() were treated as eligible to
4320  modification. I. e. in some cases Item_func_concat can append it's
4321  second argument to return value of the first one. Because of that we
4322  can't return the original buffer holding string data from val_str(),
4323  and have to have one buffer for data and another just pointing to
4324  the data. This is the latter one and it's returned from val_str().
4325  Can not be declared inside the union as it's not a POD type.
4326  */
4327  String str_value_ptr;
4328  my_decimal decimal_value;
4329  union {
4330  longlong integer;
4331  double real;
4332  MYSQL_TIME time;
4333  } value;
4334 
4335  private:
4336  /**
4337  True if type of parameter is inherited from parent object (like a typecast).
4338  Reprepare of statement will not change this type.
4339  E.g, we have CAST(? AS DOUBLE), the parameter gets data type
4340  MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE and m_type_inherited is set true.
4341  */
4342  bool m_type_inherited{false};
4343  /**
4344  True if type of parameter has been pinned, attempt to use an incompatible
4345  actual type will cause error (no repreparation occurs), and value is
4346  subject to range check. This is used when the parameter is in a context
4347  where its type is imposed. For example, in LIMIT ?, we assign
4348  data_type() == integer, unsigned; and the provided value must be
4349  convertible to unsigned integer: passing a DOUBLE, instead of causing a
4350  repreparation as for an ordinary parameter, will cause an error; passing
4351  integer '-1' will also cause an error.
4352  */
4353  bool m_type_pinned{false};
4354  /**
4355  The actual data type of the parameter value provided by the user.
4356  For example:
4357 
4358  PREPARE s FROM "SELECT ?=3e0";
4359 
4360  makes Item_param->data_type() be MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE ; then:
4361 
4362  SET @a='1';
4363  EXECUTE s USING @a;
4364 
4365  data_type() is still MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE, while m_param_state is
4366  STRING_VALUE and m_data_type_actual is MYSQL_TYPE_VAR_STRING.
4367  Compatibility of data_type() and m_data_type_actual is later tested
4368  in check_parameter_types().
4369  */
4370  enum_field_types m_data_type_actual{MYSQL_TYPE_INVALID};
4371  /// Used when actual value is integer to indicate whether value is unsigned
4372  bool m_unsigned_actual{false};
4373  /**
4374  The character set and collation of the actual parameter value.
4375  Ignored if not a string value.
4376  - If parameter value is sent over the protocol: the client collation
4377  - If parameter value is a user variable: the variable's collation
4378  */
4379  const CHARSET_INFO *m_collation_actual{nullptr};
4380  /**
4381  The character set and collation of the value stored in str_value, possibly
4382  after being converted from the m_collation_actual collation.
4383  Ignored if not a string value.
4384  - If the derived collation is binary, the connection collation.
4385  - Otherwise, the derived collation (@see Item::collation).
4386  */
4387  const CHARSET_INFO *m_collation_stored{nullptr};
4388  Item_result m_result_type{STRING_RESULT};
4389  /**
4390  m_param_state is used to indicate that no parameter value is available
4391  with NO_VALUE, or a NULL value is available (NULL_VALUE), or the actual
4392  type of the provided parameter value. Usually, this matches m_actual_type,
4393  but in the case of pinned data types, this is matching the resolved data
4394  type of the parameter. m_param_state reflects the type of the value stored
4395  in Item_param::value.
4396  */
4397  enum_item_param_state m_param_state{NO_VALUE};
4398 
4399  /**
4400  If true, when retrieving JSON data, attempt to interpret a string value as
4401  a scalar JSON value, otherwise interpret it as a JSON object.
4402  */
4403  bool m_json_as_scalar{false};
4404 
4405  /*
4406  data_type() is used when this item is used in a temporary table.
4407  This is NOT placeholder metadata sent to client, as this value
4408  is assigned after sending metadata (in setup_one_conversion_function).
4409  For example in case of 'SELECT ?' you'll get MYSQL_TYPE_STRING both
4410  in result set and placeholders metadata, no matter what type you will
4411  supply for this placeholder in mysql_stmt_execute.
4412  */
4413 
4414  public:
4415  /*
4416  Offset of placeholder inside statement text. Used to create
4417  no-placeholders version of this statement for the binary log.
4418  */
4419  uint pos_in_query;
4420 
4421  Item_param(const POS &pos, MEM_ROOT *root, uint pos_in_query_arg);
4422 
4423  bool itemize(Parse_context *pc, Item **item) override;
4424 
4425  Item_result result_type() const override { return m_result_type; }
4426  enum Type type() const override { return PARAM_ITEM; }
4427 
4428  /// Set the currently resolved data type for this parameter as inherited
4429  void set_data_type_inherited() override { m_type_inherited = true; }
4430 
4431  /// @returns true if data type for this parameter is inherited.
4432  bool is_type_inherited() const { return m_type_inherited; }
4433 
4434  /// Pin the currently resolved data type for this parameter.
4435  void pin_data_type() override { m_type_pinned = true; }
4436 
4437  /// @returns true if data type for this parameter is pinned.
4438  bool is_type_pinned() const { return m_type_pinned; }
4439 
4440  /// @returns true if actual data value (integer) is unsigned
4441  bool is_unsigned_actual() const { return m_unsigned_actual; }
4442 
4443  void set_collation_actual(const CHARSET_INFO *coll) {
4444  DBUG_ASSERT(is_string_type(m_data_type_actual));
4445  m_collation_actual = coll;
4446  }
4447  void set_collation_stored(const CHARSET_INFO *coll) {
4448  DBUG_ASSERT(is_string_type(m_data_type_actual));
4449  m_collation_stored = coll;
4450  }
4451  /// @returns the actual collation of the supplied string parameter
4452  const CHARSET_INFO *collation_actual() const {
4453  DBUG_ASSERT(is_string_type(m_data_type_actual));
4454  return m_collation_actual;
4455  }
4456  /// @returns the stored collation of the supplied string parameter
4457  const CHARSET_INFO *collation_stored() const {
4458  DBUG_ASSERT(is_string_type(m_data_type_actual));
4459  return m_collation_stored;
4460  }
4461  bool fix_fields(THD *thd, Item **ref) override;
4462 
4463  bool propagate_type(THD *thd, const Type_properties &type) override;
4464 
4465  double val_real() override;
4466  longlong val_int() override;
4467  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
4468  String *val_str(String *) override;
4469  bool val_json(Json_wrapper *result) override;
4470  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *tm) override;
4471  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *tm, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override;
4472 
4473  void set_type_actual(enum_field_types data_type, bool unsigned_act) {
4474  m_data_type_actual = data_type;
4475  m_unsigned_actual = unsigned_act;
4476  }
4477  enum_field_types data_type_actual() const { return m_data_type_actual; }
4478 
4479  enum_field_types actual_data_type() const override {
4480  return data_type_actual();
4481  }
4482 
4483  void set_null();
4484  void set_int(longlong i);
4485  void set_int(ulonglong i);
4486  void set_double(double i);
4487  void set_decimal(const char *str, ulong length);
4488  void set_decimal(const my_decimal *dv);
4489  bool set_str(const char *str, size_t length);
4490  bool set_longdata(const char *str, ulong length);
4491  void set_time(MYSQL_TIME *tm, enum_mysql_timestamp_type type);
4492  bool set_from_user_var(THD *thd, const user_var_entry *entry);
4493  void copy_param_actual_type(Item_param *from);
4494  void reset();
4495  /*
4496  Assign placeholder value from bind data.
4497  */
4498  void (*set_param_func)(Item_param *param, uchar **pos, ulong len);
4499 
4500  const String *query_val_str(const THD *thd, String *str) const;
4501 
4502  bool convert_str_value();
4503 
4504  /*
4505  Parameter is treated as constant during execution, thus it will not be
4506  evaluated during preparation.
4507  */
4508  table_map used_tables() const override { return INNER_TABLE_BIT; }
4509  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
4510  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
4511  bool is_null() override {
4512  DBUG_ASSERT(m_param_state != NO_VALUE);
4513  return m_param_state == NULL_VALUE;
4514  }
4515 
4516  /*
4517  This method is used to make a copy of a basic constant item when
4518  propagating constants in the optimizer. The reason to create a new
4519  item and not use the existing one is not precisely known (2005/04/16).
4520  Probably we are trying to preserve tree structure of items, in other
4521  words, avoid pointing at one item from two different nodes of the tree.
4522  Return a new basic constant item if parameter value is a basic
4523  constant, assert otherwise. This method is called only if
4524  basic_const_item returned true.
4525  */
4526  Item *safe_charset_converter(THD *thd, const CHARSET_INFO *tocs) override;
4527  Item *clone_item() const override;
4528  /*
4529  Implement by-value equality evaluation if parameter value
4530  is set and is a basic constant (integer, real or string).
4531  Otherwise return false.
4532  */
4533  bool eq(const Item *item, bool binary_cmp) const override;
4534  void set_param_type_and_swap_value(Item_param *from);
4535  bool is_non_const_over_literals(uchar *) override { return true; }
4536  /**
4537  This should be called after any modification done to this Item, to
4538  propagate the said modification to all its clones.
4539  */
4540  void sync_clones();
4541  bool add_clone(Item_param *i) { return m_clones.push_back(i); }
4542 
4543  private:
4544  Settable_routine_parameter *get_settable_routine_parameter() override {
4545  return this;
4546  }
4547 
4548  bool set_value(THD *, sp_rcontext *, Item **it) override;
4549 
4550  void set_out_param_info(Send_field *info) override;
4551 
4552  public:
4553  const Send_field *get_out_param_info() const override;
4554 
4555  void make_field(Send_field *field) override;
4556 
4557  bool check_function_as_value_generator(uchar *args) override {
4558  Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *func_arg =
4559  pointer_cast<Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *>(args);
4560  func_arg->err_code = func_arg->get_unnamed_function_error_code();
4561  return true;
4562  }
4563  bool check_column_from_derived_table(
4564  uchar *arg MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) override {
4565  // It is ok to push down a condition like "column > PS_parameter"
4566  return false;
4567  }
4568 
4569  private:
4570  Send_field *m_out_param_info{nullptr};
4571  /**
4572  If a query expression's text QT, containing a parameter, is internally
4573  duplicated and parsed twice (@see reparse_common_table_expression), the
4574  first parsing will create an Item_param I, and the re-parsing, which
4575  parses a forged "(QT)" parse-this-CTE type of statement, will create an
4576  Item_param J. J should not exist:
4577  - from the point of view of logging: it is not in the original query so it
4578  should not be substituted in the query written to logs (in insert_params()
4579  if with_log is true).
4580  - from the POV of the user:
4581  * user provides one single value for I, not one for I and one for J.
4582  * user expects mysql_stmt_param_count() to return 1, not 2 (count is
4583  sent by the server in send_prep_stmt()).
4584  That is why J is part neither of LEX::param_list, nor of param_array; it
4585  is considered an inferior clone of I; I::m_clones contains J.
4586  The connection between I and J is made once, by comparing their
4587  byte position in the statement, in Item_param::itemize().
4588  J gets its value from I: @see Item_param::sync_clones.
4589  */
4590  Mem_root_array<Item_param *> m_clones;
4591 };
4592 
4593 class Item_int : public Item_num {
4594  typedef Item_num super;
4595 
4596  public:
4597  longlong value;
4598  Item_int(int32 i, uint length = MY_INT32_NUM_DECIMAL_DIGITS)
4599  : value((longlong)i) {
4600  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG);
4601  max_length = length;
4602  fixed = true;
4603  }
4604  Item_int(const POS &pos, int32 i, uint length = MY_INT32_NUM_DECIMAL_DIGITS)
4605  : super(pos), value((longlong)i) {
4606  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG);
4607  max_length = length;
4608  fixed = true;
4609  }
4610  Item_int(longlong i, uint length = MY_INT64_NUM_DECIMAL_DIGITS) : value(i) {
4611  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG);
4612  max_length = length;
4613  fixed = true;
4614  }
4615  Item_int(ulonglong i, uint length = MY_INT64_NUM_DECIMAL_DIGITS)
4616  : value((longlong)i) {
4617  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG);
4618  max_length = length;
4619  fixed = true;
4620  unsigned_flag = true;
4621  }
4622  Item_int(const Item_int *item_arg) {
4623  set_data_type(item_arg->data_type());
4624  value = item_arg->value;
4625  item_name = item_arg->item_name;
4626  max_length = item_arg->max_length;
4627  fixed = true;
4628  }
4629  Item_int(const Name_string &name_arg, longlong i, uint length) : value(i) {
4630  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG);
4631  max_length = length;
4632  item_name = name_arg;
4633  fixed = true;
4634  }
4635  Item_int(const POS &pos, const Name_string &name_arg, longlong i, uint length)
4636  : super(pos), value(i) {
4637  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG);
4638  max_length = length;
4639  item_name = name_arg;
4640  fixed = true;
4641  }
4642  Item_int(const char *str_arg, uint length) {
4643  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG);
4644  init(str_arg, length);
4645  }
4646  Item_int(const POS &pos, const char *str_arg, uint length) : super(pos) {
4647  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG);
4648  init(str_arg, length);
4649  }
4650 
4651  Item_int(const POS &pos, const LEX_STRING &num, int dummy_error = 0)
4652  : Item_int(pos, num, my_strtoll10(num.str, nullptr, &dummy_error),
4653  static_cast<uint>(num.length)) {}
4654 
4655  private:
4656  void init(const char *str_arg, uint length);
4657 
4658  protected:
4659  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
4660  bool no_conversions) override;
4661 
4662  public:
4663  enum Type type() const override { return INT_ITEM; }
4664  Item_result result_type() const override { return INT_RESULT; }
4665  longlong val_int() override {
4666  DBUG_ASSERT(fixed);
4667  return value;
4668  }
4669  double val_real() override {
4670  DBUG_ASSERT(fixed);
4671  return static_cast<double>(value);
4672  }
4673  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
4674  String *val_str(String *) override;
4675  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override {
4676  return get_date_from_int(ltime, fuzzydate);
4677  }
4678  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override { return get_time_from_int(ltime); }
4679  Item *clone_item() const override { return new Item_int(this); }
4680  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
4681  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
4682  Item_num *neg() override {
4683  value = -value;
4684  return this;
4685  }
4686  uint decimal_precision() const override {
4687  return (uint)(max_length - (value < 0));
4688  }
4689  bool eq(const Item *, bool) const override;
4690  bool check_partition_func_processor(uchar *) override { return false; }
4691  bool check_function_as_value_generator(uchar *) override { return false; }
4692 };
4693 
4694 /**
4695  Item_int with value==0 and length==1
4696 */
4697 class Item_int_0 final : public Item_int {
4698  public:
4699  Item_int_0() : Item_int(NAME_STRING("0"), 0, 1) {}
4700  explicit Item_int_0(const POS &pos) : Item_int(pos, NAME_STRING("0"), 0, 1) {}
4701 };
4702 
4703 /*
4704  Item_temporal is used to store numeric representation
4705  of time/date/datetime values for queries like:
4706 
4707  WHERE datetime_column NOT IN
4708  ('2006-04-25 10:00:00','2006-04-25 10:02:00', ...);
4709 
4710  and for SHOW/INFORMATION_SCHEMA purposes (see sql_show.cc)
4711 
4712  TS-TODO: Can't we use Item_time_literal, Item_date_literal,
4713  TS-TODO: and Item_datetime_literal for this purpose?
4714 */
4715 class Item_temporal final : public Item_int {
4716  protected:
4717  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
4718  bool no_conversions) override;
4719 
4720  public:
4721  Item_temporal(enum_field_types field_type_arg, longlong i) : Item_int(i) {
4722  DBUG_ASSERT(is_temporal_type(field_type_arg));
4723  set_data_type(field_type_arg);
4724  }
4725  Item_temporal(enum_field_types field_type_arg, const Name_string &name_arg,
4726  longlong i, uint length)
4727  : Item_int(i) {
4728  DBUG_ASSERT(is_temporal_type(field_type_arg));
4729  set_data_type(field_type_arg);
4730  max_length = length;
4731  item_name = name_arg;
4732  fixed = true;
4733  }
4734  Item *clone_item() const override {
4735  return new Item_temporal(data_type(), value);
4736  }
4737  longlong val_time_temporal() override { return val_int(); }
4738  longlong val_date_temporal() override { return val_int(); }
4739  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *, my_time_flags_t) override {
4740  DBUG_ASSERT(0);
4741  return false;
4742  }
4743  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *) override {
4744  DBUG_ASSERT(0);
4745  return false;
4746  }
4747 };
4748 
4749 class Item_uint : public Item_int {
4750  protected:
4751  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
4752  bool no_conversions) override;
4753 
4754  public:
4755  Item_uint(const char *str_arg, uint length) : Item_int(str_arg, length) {
4756  unsigned_flag = true;
4757  }
4758  Item_uint(const POS &pos, const char *str_arg, uint length)
4759  : Item_int(pos, str_arg, length) {
4760  unsigned_flag = true;
4761  }
4762 
4763  Item_uint(ulonglong i) : Item_int(i, 10) {}
4764  Item_uint(const Name_string &name_arg, longlong i, uint length)
4765  : Item_int(name_arg, i, length) {
4766  unsigned_flag = true;
4767  }
4768  double val_real() override {
4769  DBUG_ASSERT(fixed);
4770  return ulonglong2double(static_cast<ulonglong>(value));
4771  }
4772  String *val_str(String *) override;
4773 
4774  Item *clone_item() const override {
4775  return new Item_uint(item_name, value, max_length);
4776  }
4777  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
4778  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
4779  Item_num *neg() override;
4780  uint decimal_precision() const override { return max_length; }
4781 };
4782 
4783 /* decimal (fixed point) constant */
4784 class Item_decimal : public Item_num {
4785  typedef Item_num super;
4786 
4787  protected:
4788  my_decimal decimal_value;
4789  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
4790  bool no_conversions) override;
4791 
4792  public:
4793  Item_decimal(const POS &pos, const char *str_arg, uint length,
4794  const CHARSET_INFO *charset);
4795  Item_decimal(const Name_string &name_arg, const my_decimal *val_arg,
4796  uint decimal_par, uint length);
4797  Item_decimal(my_decimal *value_par);
4798  Item_decimal(longlong val, bool unsig);
4799  Item_decimal(double val);
4800  Item_decimal(const uchar *bin, int precision, int scale);
4801 
4802  enum Type type() const override { return DECIMAL_ITEM; }
4803  Item_result result_type() const override { return DECIMAL_RESULT; }
4804  longlong val_int() override;
4805  double val_real() override;
4806  String *val_str(String *) override;
4807  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override { return &decimal_value; }
4808  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override {
4809  return get_date_from_decimal(ltime, fuzzydate);
4810  }
4811  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override {
4812  return get_time_from_decimal(ltime);
4813  }
4814  Item *clone_item() const override {
4815  return new Item_decimal(item_name, &decimal_value, decimals, max_length);
4816  }
4817  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
4818  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
4819  Item_num *neg() override {
4820  my_decimal_neg(&decimal_value);
4821  unsigned_flag = !decimal_value.sign();
4822  return this;
4823  }
4824  uint decimal_precision() const override { return decimal_value.precision(); }
4825  bool eq(const Item *, bool binary_cmp) const override;
4826  void set_decimal_value(const my_decimal *value_par);
4827  bool check_partition_func_processor(uchar *) override { return false; }
4828 };
4829 
4830 class Item_float : public Item_num {
4831  typedef Item_num super;
4832 
4833  Name_string presentation;
4834 
4835  public:
4836  double value;
4837  // Item_real() :value(0) {}
4838  Item_float(const char *str_arg, uint length) { init(str_arg, length); }
4839  Item_float(const POS &pos, const char *str_arg, uint length) : super(pos) {
4840  init(str_arg, length);
4841  }
4842 
4843  Item_float(const Name_string name_arg, double val_arg, uint decimal_par,
4844  uint length)
4845  : value(val_arg) {
4846  presentation = name_arg;
4847  item_name = name_arg;
4848  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE);
4849  decimals = (uint8)decimal_par;
4850  max_length = length;
4851  fixed = true;
4852  }
4853  Item_float(const POS &pos, const Name_string name_arg, double val_arg,
4854  uint decimal_par, uint length)
4855  : super(pos), value(val_arg) {
4856  presentation = name_arg;
4857  item_name = name_arg;
4858  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE);
4859  decimals = (uint8)decimal_par;
4860  max_length = length;
4861  fixed = true;
4862  }
4863 
4864  Item_float(double value_par, uint decimal_par) : value(value_par) {
4865  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE);
4866  decimals = (uint8)decimal_par;
4867  max_length = float_length(decimal_par);
4868  fixed = true;
4869  }
4870 
4871  private:
4872  void init(const char *str_arg, uint length);
4873 
4874  protected:
4875  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
4876  bool no_conversions) override;
4877 
4878  public:
4879  enum Type type() const override { return REAL_ITEM; }
4880  double val_real() override {
4881  DBUG_ASSERT(fixed);
4882  return value;
4883  }
4884  longlong val_int() override {
4885  DBUG_ASSERT(fixed == 1);
4886  if (value <= (double)LLONG_MIN) {
4887  return LLONG_MIN;
4888  } else if (value > LLONG_MAX_DOUBLE) {
4889  return LLONG_MAX;
4890  }
4891  return (longlong)rint(value);
4892  }
4893  String *val_str(String *) override;
4894  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
4895  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override {
4896  return get_date_from_real(ltime, fuzzydate);
4897  }
4898  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override {
4899  return get_time_from_real(ltime);
4900  }
4901  Item *clone_item() const override {
4902  return new Item_float(item_name, value, decimals, max_length);
4903  }
4904  Item_num *neg() override {
4905  value = -value;
4906  return this;
4907  }
4908  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
4909  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
4910  bool eq(const Item *, bool binary_cmp) const override;
4911 };
4912 
4913 class Item_func_pi : public Item_float {
4914  const Name_string func_name;
4915 
4916  public:
4917  Item_func_pi(const POS &pos)
4918  : Item_float(pos, null_name_string, M_PI, 6, 8),
4919  func_name(NAME_STRING("pi()")) {}
4920 
4921  void print(const THD *, String *str, enum_query_type) const override {
4922  str->append(func_name);
4923  }
4924 
4925  Item *safe_charset_converter(THD *thd, const CHARSET_INFO *tocs) override;
4926 };
4927 
4928 class Item_string : public Item_basic_constant {
4929  typedef Item_basic_constant super;
4930 
4931  protected:
4932  explicit Item_string(const POS &pos) : super(pos), m_cs_specified(false) {
4933  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_VARCHAR);
4934  }
4935 
4936  void init(const char *str, size_t length, const CHARSET_INFO *cs,
4937  Derivation dv, uint repertoire) {
4938  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_VARCHAR);
4939  str_value.set_or_copy_aligned(str, length, cs);
4940  collation.set(cs, dv, repertoire);
4941  /*
4942  We have to have a different max_length than 'length' here to
4943  ensure that we get the right length if we do use the item
4944  to create a new table. In this case max_length must be the maximum
4945  number of chars for a string of this type because we in Create_field::
4946  divide the max_length with mbmaxlen).
4947  */
4948  max_length = static_cast<uint32>(str_value.numchars() * cs->mbmaxlen);
4949  item_name.copy(str, length, cs);
4950  decimals = DECIMAL_NOT_SPECIFIED;
4951  // it is constant => can be used without fix_fields (and frequently used)
4952  fixed = true;
4953  /*
4954  Check if the string has any character that can't be
4955  interpreted using the relevant charset.
4956  */
4957  check_well_formed_result(&str_value, false, false);
4958  }
4959  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
4960  bool no_conversions) override;
4961 
4962  public:
4963  /* Create from a string, set name from the string itself. */
4964  Item_string(const char *str, size_t length, const CHARSET_INFO *cs,
4965  Derivation dv = DERIVATION_COERCIBLE,
4966  uint repertoire = MY_REPERTOIRE_UNICODE30)
4967  : m_cs_specified(false) {
4968  init(str, length, cs, dv, repertoire);
4969  }
4970  Item_string(const POS &pos, const char *str, size_t length,
4971  const CHARSET_INFO *cs, Derivation dv = DERIVATION_COERCIBLE,
4972  uint repertoire = MY_REPERTOIRE_UNICODE30)
4973  : super(pos), m_cs_specified(false) {
4974  init(str, length, cs, dv, repertoire);
4975  }
4976 
4977  /* Just create an item and do not fill string representation */
4978  Item_string(const CHARSET_INFO *cs, Derivation dv = DERIVATION_COERCIBLE)
4979  : m_cs_specified(false) {
4980  collation.set(cs, dv);
4981  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_VARCHAR);
4982  max_length = 0;
4983  decimals = DECIMAL_NOT_SPECIFIED;
4984  fixed = true;
4985  }
4986 
4987  /* Create from the given name and string. */
4988  Item_string(const Name_string name_par, const char *str, size_t length,
4989  const CHARSET_INFO *cs, Derivation dv = DERIVATION_COERCIBLE,
4990  uint repertoire = MY_REPERTOIRE_UNICODE30)
4991  : m_cs_specified(false) {
4992  str_value.set_or_copy_aligned(str, length, cs);
4993  collation.set(cs, dv, repertoire);
4994  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_VARCHAR);
4995  max_length = static_cast<uint32>(str_value.numchars() * cs->mbmaxlen);
4996  item_name = name_par;
4997  decimals = DECIMAL_NOT_SPECIFIED;
4998  // it is constant => can be used without fix_fields (and frequently used)
4999  fixed = true;
5000  }
5001  Item_string(const POS &pos, const Name_string name_par, const char *str,
5002  size_t length, const CHARSET_INFO *cs,
5003  Derivation dv = DERIVATION_COERCIBLE,
5004  uint repertoire = MY_REPERTOIRE_UNICODE30)
5005  : super(pos), m_cs_specified(false) {
5006  str_value.set_or_copy_aligned(str, length, cs);
5007  collation.set(cs, dv, repertoire);
5008  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_VARCHAR);
5009  max_length = static_cast<uint32>(str_value.numchars() * cs->mbmaxlen);
5010  item_name = name_par;
5011  decimals = DECIMAL_NOT_SPECIFIED;
5012  // it is constant => can be used without fix_fields (and frequently used)
5013  fixed = true;
5014  }
5015 
5016  /* Create from the given name and string. */
5017  Item_string(const POS &pos, const Name_string name_par,
5018  const LEX_CSTRING &literal, const CHARSET_INFO *cs,
5019  Derivation dv = DERIVATION_COERCIBLE,
5020  uint repertoire = MY_REPERTOIRE_UNICODE30)
5021  : super(pos), m_cs_specified(false) {
5022  str_value.set_or_copy_aligned(literal.str ? literal.str : "",
5023  literal.str ? literal.length : 0, cs);
5024  collation.set(cs, dv, repertoire);
5025  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_VARCHAR);
5026  max_length = static_cast<uint32>(str_value.numchars() * cs->mbmaxlen);
5027  item_name = name_par;
5028  decimals = DECIMAL_NOT_SPECIFIED;
5029  // it is constant => can be used without fix_fields (and frequently used)
5030  fixed = true;
5031  }
5032 
5033  /*
5034  This is used in stored procedures to avoid memory leaks and
5035  does a deep copy of its argument.
5036  */
5037  void set_str_with_copy(const char *str_arg, uint length_arg) {
5038  str_value.copy(str_arg, length_arg, collation.collation);
5039  max_length = static_cast<uint32>(str_value.numchars() *
5040  collation.collation->mbmaxlen);
5041  }
5042  void set_repertoire_from_value() {
5043  collation.repertoire = my_string_repertoire(
5044  str_value.charset(), str_value.ptr(), str_value.length());
5045  }
5046  enum Type type() const override { return STRING_ITEM; }
5047  double val_real() override;
5048  longlong val_int() override;
5049  String *val_str(String *) override {
5050  DBUG_ASSERT(fixed == 1);
5051  return &str_value;
5052  }
5053  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
5054  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override {
5055  return get_date_from_string(ltime, fuzzydate);
5056  }
5057  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override {
5058  return get_time_from_string(ltime);
5059  }
5060  Item_result result_type() const override { return STRING_RESULT; }
5061  bool eq(const Item *item, bool binary_cmp) const override;
5062  Item *clone_item() const override {
5063  return new Item_string(static_cast<Name_string>(item_name), str_value.ptr(),
5064  str_value.length(), collation.collation);
5065  }
5066  Item *safe_charset_converter(THD *thd, const CHARSET_INFO *tocs) override;
5067  Item *charset_converter(THD *thd, const CHARSET_INFO *tocs, bool lossless);
5068  inline void append(char *str, size_t length) {
5069  str_value.append(str, length);
5070  max_length = static_cast<uint32>(str_value.numchars() *
5071  collation.collation->mbmaxlen);
5072  }
5073  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
5074  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
5075  bool check_partition_func_processor(uchar *) override { return false; }
5076 
5077  /**
5078  Return true if character-set-introducer was explicitly specified in the
5079  original query for this item (text literal).
5080 
5081  This operation is to be called from Item_string::print(). The idea is
5082  that when a query is generated (re-constructed) from the Item-tree,
5083  character-set-introducers should appear only for those literals, where
5084  they were explicitly specified by the user. Otherwise, that may lead to
5085  loss collation information (character set introducers implies default
5086  collation for the literal).
5087 
5088  Basically, that makes sense only for views and hopefully will be gone
5089  one day when we start using original query as a view definition.
5090 
5091  @return This operation returns the value of m_cs_specified attribute.
5092  @retval true if character set introducer was explicitly specified in
5093  the original query.
5094  @retval false otherwise.
5095  */
5096  inline bool is_cs_specified() const { return m_cs_specified; }
5097 
5098  /**
5099  Set the value of m_cs_specified attribute.
5100 
5101  m_cs_specified attribute shows whether character-set-introducer was
5102  explicitly specified in the original query for this text literal or
5103  not. The attribute makes sense (is used) only for views.
5104 
5105  This operation is to be called from the parser during parsing an input
5106  query.
5107  */
5108  inline void set_cs_specified(bool cs_specified) {
5109  m_cs_specified = cs_specified;
5110  }
5111 
5112  void mark_result_as_const() { str_value.mark_as_const(); }
5113 
5114  private:
5115  bool m_cs_specified;
5116 };
5117 
5118 longlong longlong_from_string_with_check(const CHARSET_INFO *cs,
5119  const char *cptr, const char *end,
5120  int unsigned_target);
5121 double double_from_string_with_check(const CHARSET_INFO *cs, const char *cptr,
5122  const char *end);
5123 
5124 class Item_static_string_func : public Item_string {
5125  const Name_string func_name;
5126 
5127  public:
5128  Item_static_string_func(const Name_string &name_par, const char *str,
5129  size_t length, const CHARSET_INFO *cs,
5130  Derivation dv = DERIVATION_COERCIBLE)
5131  : Item_string(null_name_string, str, length, cs, dv),
5132  func_name(name_par) {}
5133  Item_static_string_func(const POS &pos, const Name_string &name_par,
5134  const char *str, size_t length,
5135  const CHARSET_INFO *cs,
5136  Derivation dv = DERIVATION_COERCIBLE)
5137  : Item_string(pos, null_name_string, str, length, cs, dv),
5138  func_name(name_par) {}
5139 
5140  Item *safe_charset_converter(THD *thd, const CHARSET_INFO *tocs) override;
5141 
5142  void print(const THD *, String *str, enum_query_type) const override {
5143  str->append(func_name);
5144  }
5145 
5146  bool check_partition_func_processor(uchar *) override { return true; }
5147  bool check_function_as_value_generator(uchar *args) override {
5148  Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *func_arg =
5149  pointer_cast<Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *>(args);
5150  func_arg->banned_function_name = func_name.ptr();
5151  return true;
5152  }
5153 };
5154 
5155 /* for show tables */
5156 class Item_partition_func_safe_string : public Item_string {
5157  public:
5158  Item_partition_func_safe_string(const Name_string name, size_t length,
5159  const CHARSET_INFO *cs = nullptr)
5160  : Item_string(name, NullS, 0, cs) {
5161  max_length = static_cast<uint32>(length);
5162  }
5163 };
5164 
5165 class Item_blob final : public Item_partition_func_safe_string {
5166  public:
5167  Item_blob(const char *name, size_t length)
5168  : Item_partition_func_safe_string(Name_string(name, strlen(name)), length,
5169  &my_charset_bin) {
5170  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_BLOB);
5171  }
5172  enum Type type() const override { return TYPE_HOLDER; }
5173  bool check_function_as_value_generator(uchar *args) override {
5174  Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *func_arg =
5175  pointer_cast<Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *>(args);
5176  func_arg->err_code = func_arg->get_unnamed_function_error_code();
5177  return true;
5178  }
5179 };
5180 
5181 /**
5182  Item_empty_string -- is a utility class to put an item into List<Item>
5183  which is then used in protocol.send_result_set_metadata() when sending SHOW
5184  output to the client.
5185 */
5186 
5187 class Item_empty_string : public Item_partition_func_safe_string {
5188  public:
5189  Item_empty_string(const char *header, size_t length,
5190  const CHARSET_INFO *cs = nullptr)
5191  : Item_partition_func_safe_string(Name_string(header, strlen(header)), 0,
5192  cs ? cs : &my_charset_utf8_general_ci) {
5193  max_length = static_cast<uint32>(length * collation.collation->mbmaxlen);
5194  }
5195  void make_field(Send_field *field) override;
5196 };
5197 
5198 class Item_return_int : public Item_int {
5199  public:

5201  enum_field_types field_type_arg, longlong value_arg = 0)
5202  : Item_int(Name_string(name_arg, name_arg ? strlen(name_arg) : 0),
5203  value_arg, length) {
5204  set_data_type(field_type_arg);
5205  unsigned_flag = true;
5206  }

5209 class Item_hex_string : public Item_basic_constant {
5210  typedef Item_basic_constant super;
5211 
5212  protected:
5213  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
5214  bool no_conversions) override;
5215 
5216  public:
5217  Item_hex_string();
5218  explicit Item_hex_string(const POS &pos) : super(pos) {
5219  set_data_type(MYSQL_TYPE_VARCHAR);
5220  }
5221 
5222  Item_hex_string(const char *str, uint str_length);
5223  Item_hex_string(const POS &pos, const LEX_STRING &literal);
5224 
5225  enum Type type() const override { return VARBIN_ITEM; }
5226  double val_real() override {
5227  DBUG_ASSERT(fixed);
5228  return (double)(ulonglong)Item_hex_string::val_int();
5229  }
5230  longlong val_int() override;
5231  Item *clone_item() const override {
5232  return new Item_hex_string(str_value.ptr(), max_length);
5233  }
5234  String *val_str(String *) override {
5235  DBUG_ASSERT(fixed);
5236  return &str_value;
5237  }
5238  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
5239  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override {
5240  return get_date_from_string(ltime, fuzzydate);
5241  }
5242  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override {
5243  return get_time_from_string(ltime);
5244  }
5245  Item_result result_type() const override { return STRING_RESULT; }
5246  Item_result numeric_context_result_type() const override {
5247  return INT_RESULT;
5248  }
5249  Item_result cast_to_int_type() const override { return INT_RESULT; }
5250  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
5251  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
5252  bool eq(const Item *item, bool binary_cmp) const override;
5253  Item *safe_charset_converter(THD *thd, const CHARSET_INFO *tocs) override;
5254  bool check_partition_func_processor(uchar *) override { return false; }
5255  static LEX_CSTRING make_hex_str(const char *str, size_t str_length);
5256 
5257  private:

5259 };

5262  typedef Item_hex_string super;
5263 
5264  public:
5265  Item_bin_string(const char *str, size_t str_length) {
5266  bin_string_init(str, str_length);
5267  }
5268  Item_bin_string(const POS &pos, const LEX_STRING &literal) : super(pos) {
5269  bin_string_init(literal.str, literal.length);
5270  }
