5273 
5274  private:
5275  void bin_string_init(const char *str, size_t str_length);
5276 };
5277 
5278 /**
5279  Item with result field.
5280 
5281  It adds to an Item a "result_field" Field member. This is for an item which
5282  may have a result (e.g. Item_func), and may store this result into a field;
5283  usually this field is a column of an internal temporary table. So the
5284  function may be evaluated by save_in_field(), storing result into
5285  result_field in tmp table. Then this result can be copied from tmp table to
5286  a following tmp table (e.g. GROUP BY table then ORDER BY table), or to a row
5287  buffer and back, as we want to avoid multiple evaluations of the Item, first
5288  because of performance, second because that evaluation may have side
5289  effects, e.g. SLEEP, GET_LOCK, RAND, window functions doing
5290  accumulations...
5291  Item_field and Item_ref also have a "result_field" for a similar goal.
5292  Literals don't need such "result_field" as their value is readily
5293  available.
5294 */
5295 class Item_result_field : public Item {
5296  protected:
5297  Field *result_field{nullptr}; /* Save result here */
5298  public:
5299  Item_result_field() = default;
5300  explicit Item_result_field(const POS &pos) : Item(pos) {}
5301 
5302  // Constructor used for Item_sum/Item_cond_and/or (see Item comment)
5303  Item_result_field(THD *thd, const Item_result_field *item)
5304  : Item(thd, item), result_field(item->result_field) {}
5305  Field *get_tmp_table_field() override { return result_field; }
5306  Field *tmp_table_field(TABLE *) override { return result_field; }
5307  table_map used_tables() const override { return 1; }
5308 
5309  /**
5310  Resolve type-related information for this item, such as result field type,
5311  maximum size, precision, signedness, character set and collation.
5312  Also check compatibility of argument types and return error when applicable.
5313  Also adjust nullability when applicable.
5314 
5315  @param thd thread handler
5316  @returns false if success, true if error
5317  */
5318  virtual bool resolve_type(THD *thd) = 0;
5319 
5320  void set_result_field(Field *field) override { result_field = field; }
5321  bool is_result_field() const override { return true; }
5322  Field *get_result_field() const override { return result_field; }
5323 
5324  void cleanup() override;
5325  /*
5326  This method is used for debug purposes to print the name of an
5327  item to the debug log. The second use of this method is as
5328  a helper function of print() and error messages, where it is
5329  applicable. To suit both goals it should return a meaningful,
5330  distinguishable and syntactically correct string. This method
5331  should not be used for runtime type identification, use enum
5332  {Sum}Functype and Item_func::functype()/Item_sum::sum_func()
5333  instead.
5334  Added here, to the parent class of both Item_func and Item_sum.
5335  */
5336  virtual const char *func_name() const = 0;
5337  bool check_function_as_value_generator(uchar *) override { return false; }
5338  bool mark_field_in_map(uchar *arg) override {
5339  bool rc = Item::mark_field_in_map(arg);
5340  if (result_field) // most likely result_field will be read too
5341  rc |= Item::mark_field_in_map(pointer_cast<Mark_field *>(arg),
5342  result_field);
5343  return rc;
5344  }
5345 
5346  longlong llrint_with_overflow_check(double realval) {
5347  if (realval < LLONG_MIN || realval > LLONG_MAX_DOUBLE) {
5348  raise_integer_overflow();
5349  return error_int();
5350  }
5351  return llrint(realval);
5352  }
5353 
5354  void raise_numeric_overflow(const char *type_name);
5355 
5356  double raise_float_overflow() {
5357  raise_numeric_overflow("DOUBLE");
5358  return 0.0;
5359  }
5360 
5361  longlong raise_integer_overflow() {
5362  raise_numeric_overflow(unsigned_flag ? "BIGINT UNSIGNED" : "BIGINT");
5363  return 0;
5364  }
5365 
5366  int raise_decimal_overflow() {
5367  raise_numeric_overflow(unsigned_flag ? "DECIMAL UNSIGNED" : "DECIMAL");
5368  return E_DEC_OVERFLOW;
5369  }
5370 };
5371 
5372 class Item_ref : public Item_ident {
5373  protected:
5374  void set_properties();
5375  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
5376  bool no_conversions) override;
5377 
5378  public:
5379  enum Ref_Type { REF, VIEW_REF, OUTER_REF, AGGREGATE_REF };
5380 
5381  private:
5382  Field *result_field{nullptr}; /* Save result here */
5383  public:
5384  Item **ref;
5385 
5386  public:
5387  Item_ref(Name_resolution_context *context_arg, const char *db_name_arg,
5388  const char *table_name_arg, const char *field_name_arg)
5389  : Item_ident(context_arg, db_name_arg, table_name_arg, field_name_arg),
5390  ref(nullptr) {}
5391  Item_ref(const POS &pos, const char *db_name_arg, const char *table_name_arg,
5392  const char *field_name_arg)
5393  : Item_ident(pos, db_name_arg, table_name_arg, field_name_arg),
5394  ref(nullptr) {}
5395 
5396  /*
5397  This constructor is used in two scenarios:
5398  A) *item = NULL
5399  No initialization is performed, fix_fields() call will be necessary.
5400 
5401  B) *item points to an Item this Item_ref will refer to. This is
5402  used for GROUP BY. fix_fields() will not be called in this case,
5403  so we call set_properties to make this item "fixed". set_properties
5404  performs a subset of action Item_ref::fix_fields does, and this subset
5405  is enough for Item_ref's used in GROUP BY.
5406 
5407  TODO we probably fix a superset of problems like in BUG#6658. Check this
5408  with Bar, and if we have a more broader set of problems like this.
5409  */
5410  Item_ref(Name_resolution_context *context_arg, Item **item,
5411  const char *db_name_arg, const char *table_name_arg,
5412  const char *field_name_arg, bool alias_of_expr_arg = false);
5413  Item_ref(Name_resolution_context *context_arg, Item **item,
5414  const char *field_name_arg);
5415 
5416  /* Constructor need to process subselect with temporary tables (see Item) */
5417  Item_ref(THD *thd, Item_ref *item)
5418  : Item_ident(thd, item),
5419  result_field(item->result_field),
5420  ref(item->ref) {}
5421  enum Type type() const override { return REF_ITEM; }
5422  bool eq(const Item *item, bool binary_cmp) const override {
5423  const Item *it = const_cast<Item *>(item)->real_item();
5424  return ref && (*ref)->eq(it, binary_cmp);
5425  }
5426  double val_real() override;
5427  longlong val_int() override;
5428  longlong val_time_temporal() override;
5429  longlong val_date_temporal() override;
5430  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
5431  bool val_bool() override;
5432  String *val_str(String *tmp) override;
5433  bool val_json(Json_wrapper *result) override;
5434  bool is_null() override;
5435  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override;
5436  bool send(Protocol *prot, String *tmp) override;
5437  void make_field(Send_field *field) override;
5438  bool fix_fields(THD *, Item **) override;
5439  void fix_after_pullout(SELECT_LEX *parent_select,
5440  SELECT_LEX *removed_select) override;
5441  void save_org_in_field(Field *field) override;
5442  Item_result result_type() const override { return (*ref)->result_type(); }
5443  Field *get_tmp_table_field() override {
5444  return result_field ? result_field : (*ref)->get_tmp_table_field();
5445  }
5446  Item *get_tmp_table_item(THD *thd) override;
5447  table_map used_tables() const override {
5448  if (depended_from != nullptr) return OUTER_REF_TABLE_BIT;
5449  const table_map map = (*ref)->used_tables();
5450  if (map != 0) return map;
5451  // rollup constant: ensure it is non-constant by returning RAND_TABLE_BIT
5452  if (has_rollup_expr()) return RAND_TABLE_BIT;
5453  return 0;
5454  }
5455  void update_used_tables() override {
5456  if (!depended_from) (*ref)->update_used_tables();
5457  /*
5458  Reset all flags except rollup, since we do not mark the rollup expression
5459  itself.
5460  */
5461  m_accum_properties &= PROP_ROLLUP_EXPR;
5462  add_accum_properties(*ref);
5463  }
5464 
5465  table_map not_null_tables() const override {
5466  /*
5467  It can happen that our 'depended_from' member is set but the
5468  'depended_from' member of the referenced item is not (example: if a
5469  field in a subquery belongs to an outer merged view), so we first test
5470  ours:
5471  */
5472  return depended_from ? OUTER_REF_TABLE_BIT : (*ref)->not_null_tables();
5473  }
5474  void set_result_field(Field *field) override { result_field = field; }
5475  bool is_result_field() const override { return true; }
5476  Field *get_result_field() const override { return result_field; }
5477  Item *real_item() override { return ref ? (*ref)->real_item() : this; }
5478  bool walk(Item_processor processor, enum_walk walk, uchar *arg) override {
5479  return ((walk & enum_walk::PREFIX) && (this->*processor)(arg)) ||
5480  // For having clauses 'ref' will consistently =NULL.
5481  (ref != nullptr ? (*ref)->walk(processor, walk, arg) : false) ||
5482  ((walk & enum_walk::POSTFIX) && (this->*processor)(arg));
5483  }
5484  Item *transform(Item_transformer, uchar *arg) override;
5485  Item *compile(Item_analyzer analyzer, uchar **arg_p,
5486  Item_transformer transformer, uchar *arg_t) override;
5487  bool explain_subquery_checker(uchar **) override {
5488  /*
5489  Always return false: we don't need to go deeper into referenced
5490  expression tree since we have to mark aliased subqueries at
5491  their original places (select list, derived tables), not by
5492  references from other expression (order by etc).
5493  */
5494  return false;
5495  }
5496  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
5497  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
5498  void cleanup() override;
5499  Item_field *field_for_view_update() override {
5500  return (*ref)->field_for_view_update();
5501  }
5502  virtual Ref_Type ref_type() const { return REF; }
5503 
5504  // Row emulation: forwarding of ROW-related calls to ref
5505  uint cols() const override {
5506  return ref && result_type() == ROW_RESULT ? (*ref)->cols() : 1;
5507  }
5508  Item *element_index(uint i) override {
5509  return ref && result_type() == ROW_RESULT ? (*ref)->element_index(i) : this;
5510  }
5511  Item **addr(uint i) override {
5512  return ref && result_type() == ROW_RESULT ? (*ref)->addr(i) : nullptr;
5513  }
5514  bool check_cols(uint c) override {
5515  return ref && result_type() == ROW_RESULT ? (*ref)->check_cols(c)
5516  : Item::check_cols(c);
5517  }
5518  bool null_inside() override {
5519  return ref && result_type() == ROW_RESULT ? (*ref)->null_inside() : false;
5520  }
5521  void bring_value() override {
5522  if (ref && result_type() == ROW_RESULT) (*ref)->bring_value();
5523  }
5524  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override {
5525  DBUG_ASSERT(fixed);
5526  return (*ref)->get_time(ltime);
5527  }
5528 
5529  /**
5530  @todo Consider re-implementing this for Item_view_ref, as it
5531  may return NULL even if it wraps a constant value, if one the
5532  inner side of an outer join.
5533  */
5534  bool basic_const_item() const override {
5535  return ref && (*ref)->basic_const_item();
5536  }
5537  bool is_outer_field() const override {
5538  DBUG_ASSERT(fixed);
5539  DBUG_ASSERT(ref);
5540  return (*ref)->is_outer_field();
5541  }
5542 
5543  bool created_by_in2exists() const override {
5544  return (*ref)->created_by_in2exists();
5545  }
5546 
5547  bool repoint_const_outer_ref(uchar *arg) override;
5548  bool references_select_expr_of(uchar *arg) override;
5549  bool is_non_const_over_literals(uchar *) override { return true; }
5550  bool check_function_as_value_generator(uchar *args) override {
5551  Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *func_arg =
5552  pointer_cast<Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *>(args);
5553  func_arg->err_code = func_arg->get_unnamed_function_error_code();
5554  return true;
5555  }
5556  Item_result cast_to_int_type() const override {
5557  return (*ref)->cast_to_int_type();
5558  }
5559  bool check_column_from_derived_table(uchar *arg) override {
5560  return (*ref)->check_column_from_derived_table(arg);
5561  }
5562  bool check_column_in_window_functions(uchar *arg) override {
5563  return (*ref)->check_column_in_window_functions(arg);
5564  }
5565  bool check_column_in_group_by(uchar *arg) override {
5566  return (*ref)->check_column_in_group_by(arg);
5567  }
5568 };
5569 
5570 /**
5571  Class for fields from derived tables and views.
5572  The same as Item_ref, but call fix_fields() of reference if
5573  not called yet.
5574 */
5575 class Item_view_ref final : public Item_ref {
5576  typedef Item_ref super;
5577 
5578  public:
5579  Item_view_ref(Name_resolution_context *context_arg, Item **item,
5580  const char *db_name_arg, const char *alias_name_arg,
5581  const char *table_name_arg, const char *field_name_arg,
5582  TABLE_LIST *tl)
5583  : Item_ref(context_arg, item, db_name_arg, alias_name_arg,
5584  field_name_arg),
5585  first_inner_table(nullptr) {
5586  if (tl->is_view()) {
5587  m_orig_db_name = db_name_arg;
5588  m_orig_table_name = table_name_arg;
5589  } else {
5590  DBUG_ASSERT(db_name_arg == nullptr);
5591  m_orig_table_name = table_name_arg;
5592  }
5593  cached_table = tl;
5594  if (cached_table->is_inner_table_of_outer_join()) {
5595  maybe_null = true;
5596  first_inner_table = cached_table->any_outer_leaf_table();
5597  }
5598  }
5599 
5600  /*
5601  We share one underlying Item_field, so we have to disable
5602  build_equal_items_for_cond().
5603  TODO: Implement multiple equality optimization for views.
5604  */
5605  bool subst_argument_checker(uchar **) override { return false; }
5606 
5607  bool fix_fields(THD *, Item **) override;
5608 
5609  /**
5610  Takes into account whether an Item in a derived table / view is part of an
5611  inner table of an outer join.
5612 
5613  1) If the field is an outer reference, return OUTER_TABLE_REF_BIT.
5614  2) Else
5615  2a) If the field is const_for_execution and the field is used in the
5616  inner part of an outer join, return the inner tables of the outer
5617  join. (A 'const' field that depends on the inner table of an outer
5618  join shouldn't be interpreted as const.)
5619  2b) Else return the used_tables info of the underlying field.
5620 
5621  @note The call to const_for_execution has been replaced by
5622  "!(inner_map & ~INNER_TABLE_BIT)" to avoid multiple and recursive
5623  calls to used_tables. This can create a problem when Views are
5624  created using other views
5625 */
5626  table_map used_tables() const override {
5627  if (depended_from != nullptr) return OUTER_REF_TABLE_BIT;
5628 
5629  table_map inner_map = (*ref)->used_tables();
5630  return !(inner_map & ~INNER_TABLE_BIT) && first_inner_table != nullptr
5631  ? (*ref)->real_item()->type() == FIELD_ITEM
5632  ? down_cast<Item_field *>((*ref)->real_item())
5633  ->table_ref->map()
5634  : first_inner_table->map()
5635  : inner_map;
5636  }
5637 
5638  bool eq(const Item *item, bool) const override;
5639  Item *get_tmp_table_item(THD *thd) override {
5640  DBUG_TRACE;
5641  Item *item = Item_ref::get_tmp_table_item(thd);
5642  item->item_name = item_name;
5643  return item;
5644  }
5645  Ref_Type ref_type() const override { return VIEW_REF; }
5646 
5647  bool check_column_privileges(uchar *arg) override;
5648  bool mark_field_in_map(uchar *arg) override {
5649  /*
5650  If this referenced column is marked as used, flag underlying
5651  selected item from a derived table/view as used.
5652  */
5653  auto mark_field = (Mark_field *)arg;
5654  if (mark_field->mark != MARK_COLUMNS_NONE)
5655  // Set the same flag for all the objects that *ref depends on.
5656  (*ref)->walk(&Item::propagate_set_derived_used,
5657  enum_walk::SUBQUERY_POSTFIX, nullptr);
5658  return get_result_field()
5659  ? Item::mark_field_in_map(mark_field, get_result_field())
5660  : false;
5661  }
5662  longlong val_int() override;
5663  double val_real() override;
5664  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *dec) override;
5665  String *val_str(String *str) override;
5666  bool val_bool() override;
5667  bool val_json(Json_wrapper *wr) override;
5668  bool is_null() override;
5669  bool send(Protocol *prot, String *tmp) override;
5670  bool collect_item_field_or_view_ref_processor(uchar *arg) override;
5671  Item *replace_item_view_ref(uchar *arg) override;
5672 
5673  protected:
5674  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
5675  bool no_conversions) override;
5676 
5677  private:
5678  /// @return true if item is from a null-extended row from an outer join
5679  bool has_null_row() const {
5680  return first_inner_table && first_inner_table->table->has_null_row();
5681  }
5682 
5683  /**
5684  If this column belongs to a view that is an inner table of an outer join,
5685  then this field points to the first leaf table of the view, otherwise NULL.
5686  */
5687  TABLE_LIST *first_inner_table;
5688 };
5689 
5690 /*
5691  Class for outer fields.
5692  An object of this class is created when the select where the outer field was
5693  resolved is a grouping one. After it has been fixed the ref field will point
5694  to an Item_ref object which will be used to access the field.
5695  The ref field may also point to an Item_field instance.
5696  See also comments of the Item_field::fix_outer_field() function.
5697 */
5698 
5699 class Item_outer_ref final : public Item_ref {
5700  typedef Item_ref super;
5701 
5702  private:
5703  /**
5704  Qualifying query of this outer ref (i.e. query block which owns FROM of
5705  table which this Item references).
5706  */
5707  SELECT_LEX *qualifying;
5708 
5709  public:
5710  Item *outer_ref;
5711  /* The aggregate function under which this outer ref is used, if any. */
5712  Item_sum *in_sum_func;
5713  /*
5714  true <=> that the outer_ref is already present in the select list
5715  of the outer select.
5716  */
5717  bool found_in_select_list;
5718  Item_outer_ref(Name_resolution_context *context_arg, Item_ident *ident_arg,
5719  SELECT_LEX *qualifying)
5720  : Item_ref(context_arg, nullptr, ident_arg->db_name,
5721  ident_arg->table_name, ident_arg->field_name, false),
5722  qualifying(qualifying),
5723  outer_ref(ident_arg),
5724  in_sum_func(nullptr),
5725  found_in_select_list(false) {
5726  ref = &outer_ref;
5727  set_properties();
5728  fixed = false;
5729  }
5730  Item_outer_ref(Name_resolution_context *context_arg, Item **item,
5731  const char *db_name_arg, const char *table_name_arg,
5732  const char *field_name_arg, bool alias_of_expr_arg,
5733  SELECT_LEX *qualifying)
5734  : Item_ref(context_arg, item, db_name_arg, table_name_arg, field_name_arg,
5735  alias_of_expr_arg),
5736  qualifying(qualifying),
5737  outer_ref(nullptr),
5738  in_sum_func(nullptr),
5739  found_in_select_list(true) {}
5740  bool fix_fields(THD *, Item **) override;
5741  void fix_after_pullout(SELECT_LEX *parent_select,
5742  SELECT_LEX *removed_select) override;
5743  table_map used_tables() const override {
5744  return (*ref)->used_tables() == 0 ? 0 : OUTER_REF_TABLE_BIT;
5745  }
5746  table_map not_null_tables() const override { return 0; }
5747 
5748  Ref_Type ref_type() const override { return OUTER_REF; }
5749 };
5750 
5751 class Item_in_subselect;
5752 
5753 /*
5754  An object of this class is like Item_ref, and
5755  sets owner->was_null=true if it has returned a NULL value from any
5756  val_XXX() function. This allows to inject an Item_ref_null_helper
5757  object into subquery and then check if the subquery has produced a row
5758  with NULL value.
5759 */
5760 
5761 class Item_ref_null_helper final : public Item_ref {
5762  typedef Item_ref super;
5763 
5764  protected:
5765  Item_in_subselect *owner;
5766 
5767  public:
5768  Item_ref_null_helper(Name_resolution_context *context_arg,
5769  Item_in_subselect *master, Item **item)
5770  : super(context_arg, item, "", "", ""), owner(master) {}
5771  double val_real() override;
5772  longlong val_int() override;
5773  longlong val_time_temporal() override;
5774  longlong val_date_temporal() override;
5775  String *val_str(String *s) override;
5776  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
5777  bool val_bool() override;
5778  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override;
5779  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
5780  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
5781  /*
5782  we add RAND_TABLE_BIT to prevent moving this item from HAVING to WHERE
5783  */
5784  table_map used_tables() const override {
5785  return (depended_from ? OUTER_REF_TABLE_BIT
5786  : (*ref)->used_tables() | RAND_TABLE_BIT);
5787  }
5788 };
5789 
5790 /*
5791  The following class is used to optimize comparing of bigint columns.
5792  We need to save the original item ('ref') to be able to call
5793  ref->save_in_field(). This is used to create index search keys.
5794 
5795  An instance of Item_int_with_ref may have signed or unsigned integer value.
5796 
5797 */
5798 
5799 class Item_int_with_ref : public Item_int {
5800  protected:
5801  Item *ref;
5802  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
5803  bool no_conversions) override {
5804  return ref->save_in_field(field, no_conversions);
5805  }
5806 
5807  public:
5808  Item_int_with_ref(enum_field_types field_type, longlong i, Item *ref_arg,
5809  bool unsigned_arg)
5810  : Item_int(i), ref(ref_arg) {
5811  set_data_type(field_type);
5812  unsigned_flag = unsigned_arg;
5813  }
5814  Item *clone_item() const override;
5815  Item *real_item() override { return ref; }
5816 };
5817 
5818 /*
5819  Similar to Item_int_with_ref, but to optimize comparing of temporal columns.
5820 */
5821 class Item_temporal_with_ref : public Item_int_with_ref {
5822  public:
5823  Item_temporal_with_ref(enum_field_types field_type_arg, uint8 decimals_arg,
5824  longlong i, Item *ref_arg, bool unsigned_arg)
5825  : Item_int_with_ref(field_type_arg, i, ref_arg, unsigned_arg) {
5826  decimals = decimals_arg;
5827  }
5828  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
5829  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
5830  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *, my_time_flags_t) override {
5831  DBUG_ASSERT(0);
5832  return true;
5833  }
5834  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *) override {
5835  DBUG_ASSERT(0);
5836  return true;
5837  }
5838 };
5839 
5840 /*
5841  Item_datetime_with_ref is used to optimize queries like:
5842  SELECT ... FROM t1 WHERE date_or_datetime_column = 20110101101010;
5843  The numeric constant is replaced to Item_datetime_with_ref
5844  by convert_constant_item().
5845 */
5846 class Item_datetime_with_ref final : public Item_temporal_with_ref {
5847  public:
5848  /**
5849  Constructor for Item_datetime_with_ref.
5850  @param field_type_arg Data type: MYSQL_TYPE_DATE or MYSQL_TYPE_DATETIME
5851  @param decimals_arg Number of fractional digits.
5852  @param i Temporal value in packed format.
5853  @param ref_arg Pointer to the original numeric Item.
5854  */
5855  Item_datetime_with_ref(enum_field_types field_type_arg, uint8 decimals_arg,
5856  longlong i, Item *ref_arg)
5857  : Item_temporal_with_ref(field_type_arg, decimals_arg, i, ref_arg, true) {
5858  }
5859  Item *clone_item() const override;
5860  longlong val_date_temporal() override { return val_int(); }
5861  longlong val_time_temporal() override {
5862  DBUG_ASSERT(0);
5863  return val_int();
5864  }
5865 };
5866 
5867 /*
5868  Item_time_with_ref is used to optimize queries like:
5869  SELECT ... FROM t1 WHERE time_column = 20110101101010;
5870  The numeric constant is replaced to Item_time_with_ref
5871  by convert_constant_item().
5872 */
5873 class Item_time_with_ref final : public Item_temporal_with_ref {
5874  public:
5875  /**
5876  Constructor for Item_time_with_ref.
5877  @param decimals_arg Number of fractional digits.
5878  @param i Temporal value in packed format.
5879  @param ref_arg Pointer to the original numeric Item.
5880  */
5881  Item_time_with_ref(uint8 decimals_arg, longlong i, Item *ref_arg)
5882  : Item_temporal_with_ref(MYSQL_TYPE_TIME, decimals_arg, i, ref_arg,
5883  false) {}
5884  Item *clone_item() const override;
5885  longlong val_time_temporal() override { return val_int(); }
5886  longlong val_date_temporal() override {
5887  DBUG_ASSERT(0);
5888  return val_int();
5889  }
5890 };
5891 
5892 /**
5893  Base class to implement typed value caching Item classes
5894 
5895  Item_copy_ classes are very similar to the corresponding Item_
5896  classes (e.g. Item_copy_int is similar to Item_int) but they add
5897  the following additional functionality to Item_ :
5898  1. Nullability
5899  2. Possibility to store the value not only on instantiation time,
5900  but also later.
5901  Item_copy_ classes are a functionality subset of Item_cache_
5902  classes, as e.g. they don't support comparisons with the original Item
5903  as Item_cache_ classes do.
5904  Item_copy_ classes are used in GROUP BY calculation.
5905  TODO: Item_copy should be made an abstract interface and Item_copy_
5906  classes should inherit both the respective Item_ class and the interface.
5907  Ideally we should drop Item_copy_ classes altogether and merge
5908  their functionality to Item_cache_ (and these should be made to inherit
5909  from Item_).
5910 */
5911 
5912 class Item_copy : public Item {
5913  protected:
5914  /** The original item that is copied */
5915  Item *item;
5916 
5917  /**
5918  Stores the result type of the original item, so it can be returned
5919  without calling the original item's method
5920  */
5921  Item_result cached_result_type;
5922 
5923  /**
5924  Constructor of the Item_copy class
5925 
5926  stores metadata information about the original class as well as a
5927  pointer to it.
5928  */
5929  Item_copy(Item *i) {
5930  item = i;
5931  null_value = maybe_null = item->maybe_null;
5932  decimals = item->decimals;
5933  max_length = item->max_length;
5934  item_name = item->item_name;
5935  set_data_type(item->data_type());
5936  cached_result_type = item->result_type();
5937  unsigned_flag = item->unsigned_flag;
5938  fixed = item->fixed;
5939  collation.set(item->collation);
5940  }
5941 
5942  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
5943  bool no_conversions) override = 0;
5944 
5945  public:
5946  /**
5947  Factory method to create the appropriate subclass dependent on the type of
5948  the original item.
5949 
5950  @param item the original item.
5951  */
5952  static Item_copy *create(Item *item);
5953 
5954  /**
5955  Update the cache with the value of the original item
5956 
5957  This is the method that updates the cached value.
5958  It must be explicitly called by the user of this class to store the value
5959  of the orginal item in the cache.
5960  @returns false if OK, true on error.
5961  */
5962  virtual bool copy(const THD *thd) = 0;
5963 
5964  virtual Item *get_item() { return item; }
5965  /** All of the subclasses should have the same type tag */
5966  enum Type type() const override { return COPY_STR_ITEM; }
5967  Item_result result_type() const override { return cached_result_type; }
5968 
5969  void make_field(Send_field *field) override { item->make_field(field); }
5970 
5971  /*
5972  The likely reason for used_tables() to return 1 is that Item_copy
5973  represents a field in a temporary table used for group expressions,
5974  and such tables are represented with table map = 1.
5975  */
5976  table_map used_tables() const override { return 1; }
5977 
5978  bool is_null() override { return null_value; }
5979 
5980  void no_rows_in_result() override { item->no_rows_in_result(); }
5981 
5982  /*
5983  Override the methods below as pure virtual to make sure all the
5984  sub-classes implement them.
5985  */
5986 
5987  String *val_str(String *) override = 0;
5988  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override = 0;
5989  double val_real() override = 0;
5990  longlong val_int() override = 0;
5991  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override = 0;
5992  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override = 0;
5993  /* purecov: begin deadcode */
5994  bool val_json(Json_wrapper *) override {
5995  DBUG_ASSERT(false);
5996  my_error(ER_NOT_SUPPORTED_YET, MYF(0), "item type for JSON");
5997  return error_json();
5998  }
5999  /* purecov: end */
6000  bool check_function_as_value_generator(uchar *args) override {
6001  Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *func_arg =
6002  pointer_cast<Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *>(args);
6003  func_arg->banned_function_name = "values";
6004  return true;
6005  }
6006 };
6007 
6008 /**
6009  Implementation of a string cache.
6010 
6011  Uses Item::str_value for storage
6012 */
6013 class Item_copy_string final : public Item_copy {
6014  protected:
6015  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
6016  bool no_conversions) override;
6017 
6018  public:
6019  Item_copy_string(Item *item_arg) : Item_copy(item_arg) {}
6020 
6021  String *val_str(String *) override;
6022  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
6023  double val_real() override;
6024  longlong val_int() override;
6025  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override;
6026  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override;
6027  bool copy(const THD *thd) override;
6028 };
6029 
6030 class Item_copy_json final : public Item_copy {
6031  Json_wrapper *m_value;
6032 
6033  protected:
6034  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
6035  bool no_conversions) override;
6036 
6037  public:
6038  explicit Item_copy_json(Item *item);
6039  ~Item_copy_json() override;
6040  bool copy(const THD *thd) override;
6041  bool val_json(Json_wrapper *) override;
6042  String *val_str(String *) override;
6043  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
6044  double val_real() override;
6045  longlong val_int() override;
6046  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override;
6047  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override;
6048 };
6049 
6050 class Item_copy_int : public Item_copy {
6051  protected:
6052  longlong cached_value;
6053  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
6054  bool no_conversions) override;
6055 
6056  public:
6057  Item_copy_int(Item *i) : Item_copy(i) {}
6058 
6059  String *val_str(String *) override;
6060  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
6061  double val_real() override { return null_value ? 0.0 : (double)cached_value; }
6062  longlong val_int() override { return null_value ? 0LL : cached_value; }
6063  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override {
6064  return get_date_from_int(ltime, fuzzydate);
6065  }
6066  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override { return get_time_from_int(ltime); }
6067  bool copy(const THD *thd) override;
6068 };
6069 
6070 class Item_copy_uint final : public Item_copy_int {
6071  public:
6072  Item_copy_uint(Item *item_arg) : Item_copy_int(item_arg) {
6073  unsigned_flag = true;
6074  }
6075 
6076  String *val_str(String *) override;
6077  double val_real() override {
6078  return null_value ? 0.0 : (double)(ulonglong)cached_value;
6079  }
6080 };
6081 
6082 class Item_copy_float final : public Item_copy {
6083  protected:
6084  double cached_value;
6085  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
6086  bool no_conversions) override;
6087 
6088  public:
6089  Item_copy_float(Item *i) : Item_copy(i) {}
6090 
6091  String *val_str(String *) override;
6092  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
6093  double val_real() override { return null_value ? 0.0 : cached_value; }
6094  longlong val_int() override { return (longlong)rint(val_real()); }
6095  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override {
6096  return get_date_from_real(ltime, fuzzydate);
6097  }
6098  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override {
6099  return get_time_from_real(ltime);
6100  }
6101  bool copy(const THD *thd) override;
6102 };
6103 
6104 class Item_copy_decimal final : public Item_copy {
6105  protected:
6106  my_decimal cached_value;
6107  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
6108  bool no_conversions) override;
6109 
6110  public:
6111  Item_copy_decimal(Item *i) : Item_copy(i) {}
6112 
6113  String *val_str(String *) override;
6114  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override {
6115  return null_value ? nullptr : &cached_value;
6116  }
6117  double val_real() override;
6118  longlong val_int() override;
6119  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override {
6120  return get_date_from_decimal(ltime, fuzzydate);
6121  }
6122  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override {
6123  return get_time_from_decimal(ltime);
6124  }
6125  bool copy(const THD *thd) override;
6126 };
6127 
6128 class Item_cache;
6129 
6130 /**
6131  This is used for segregating rows in groups (e.g. GROUP BY, windows), to
6132  detect boundaries of groups.
6133  It caches a value, which is representative of the group, and can compare it
6134  to another row, and update its value when entering a new group.
6135 */
6136 class Cached_item {
6137  protected:
6138  Item *item; ///< The item whose value to cache.
6139  public:
6140  bool null_value;
6141  Cached_item(Item *i) : item(i), null_value(false) {}
6142  /**
6143  If cached value is different from item's, returns true and updates
6144  cached value with item's.
6145  */
6146  virtual bool cmp() = 0;
6147  virtual ~Cached_item(); /*line -e1509 */
6148  Item *get_item() { return item; }
6149  virtual void copy_to_Item_cache(Item_cache *i_c MY_ATTRIBUTE((unused))) {
6150  DBUG_ASSERT(false); /* purecov: inspected */
6151  }
6152 };
6153 
6154 class Cached_item_str : public Cached_item {
6155  uint32 value_max_length;
6156  String value, tmp_value;
6157 
6158  public:
6159  Cached_item_str(THD *thd, Item *arg);
6160  bool cmp() override;
6161  ~Cached_item_str() override; // Deallocate String:s
6162  void copy_to_Item_cache(Item_cache *i_c) override;
6163 };
6164 
6165 /// Cached_item subclass for JSON values.
6166 class Cached_item_json : public Cached_item {
6167  Json_wrapper *m_value; ///< The cached JSON value.
6168  public:
6169  explicit Cached_item_json(Item *item);
6170  ~Cached_item_json() override;
6171  bool cmp() override;
6172  void copy_to_Item_cache(Item_cache *i_c) override;
6173 };
6174 
6175 class Cached_item_real : public Cached_item {
6176  double value;
6177 
6178  public:
6179  Cached_item_real(Item *item_par) : Cached_item(item_par), value(0.0) {}
6180  bool cmp() override;
6181  void copy_to_Item_cache(Item_cache *i_c) override;
6182 };
6183 
6184 class Cached_item_int : public Cached_item {
6185  longlong value;
6186 
6187  public:
6188  Cached_item_int(Item *item_par) : Cached_item(item_par), value(0) {}
6189  bool cmp() override;
6190  void copy_to_Item_cache(Item_cache *i_c) override;
6191 };
6192 
6193 class Cached_item_temporal : public Cached_item {
6194  longlong value;
6195 
6196  public:
6197  Cached_item_temporal(Item *item_par) : Cached_item(item_par), value(0) {}
6198  bool cmp() override;
6199  void copy_to_Item_cache(Item_cache *i_c) override;
6200 };
6201 
6202 class Cached_item_decimal : public Cached_item {
6203  my_decimal value;
6204 
6205  public:
6206  Cached_item_decimal(Item *item_par);
6207  bool cmp() override;
6208  void copy_to_Item_cache(Item_cache *i_c) override;
6209 };
6210 
6211 class Item_default_value final : public Item_field {
6212  typedef Item_field super;
6213 
6214  protected:
6215  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
6216  bool no_conversions) override;
6217 
6218  public:
6219  Item_default_value(const POS &pos, Item *a = nullptr)
6220  : super(pos, nullptr, nullptr, nullptr), arg(a) {}
6221  bool itemize(Parse_context *pc, Item **res) override;
6222  enum Type type() const override { return DEFAULT_VALUE_ITEM; }
6223  bool eq(const Item *item, bool binary_cmp) const override;
6224  bool fix_fields(THD *, Item **) override;
6225  void bind_fields() override;
6226  void cleanup() override { Item::cleanup(); }
6227  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
6228  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
6229  table_map used_tables() const override { return 0; }
6230  Item *get_tmp_table_item(THD *thd) override { return copy_or_same(thd); }
6231 
6232  /*
6233  No additional privilege check for default values, as the walk() function
6234  checks privileges for the underlying column through the argument.
6235  */
6236  bool check_column_privileges(uchar *) override { return false; }
6237 
6238  bool walk(Item_processor processor, enum_walk walk, uchar *args) override {
6239  return ((walk & enum_walk::PREFIX) && (this->*processor)(args)) ||
6240  (arg && arg->walk(processor, walk, args)) ||
6241  ((walk & enum_walk::POSTFIX) && (this->*processor)(args));
6242  }
6243 
6244  bool check_gcol_depend_default_processor(uchar *args) override {
6245  return !my_strcasecmp(system_charset_info, field_name,
6246  reinterpret_cast<char *>(args));
6247  }
6248 
6249  Item *transform(Item_transformer transformer, uchar *args) override;
6250 
6251  private:
6252  /// The argument for this function
6253  Item *arg;
6254  /// Pointer to row buffer that was used to calculate field value offset
6255  uchar *m_rowbuffer_saved{nullptr};
6256 };
6257 
6258 /*
6259  Item_insert_value -- an implementation of VALUES() function.
6260  You can use the VALUES(col_name) function in the UPDATE clause
6261  to refer to column values from the INSERT portion of the INSERT
6262  ... UPDATE statement. In other words, VALUES(col_name) in the
6263  UPDATE clause refers to the value of col_name that would be
6264  inserted, had no duplicate-key conflict occurred.
6265  In all other places this function returns NULL.
6266 */
6267 
6268 class Item_insert_value final : public Item_field {
6269  protected:
6270  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field_arg,
6271  bool no_conversions) override {
6272  return Item_field::save_in_field_inner(field_arg, no_conversions);
6273  }
6274 
6275  public:
6276  /**
6277  Constructs an Item_insert_value that represents a call to the deprecated
6278  VALUES function.
6279  */
6280  Item_insert_value(const POS &pos, Item *a)
6281  : Item_field(pos, nullptr, nullptr, nullptr),
6282  arg(a),
6283  m_is_values_function(true) {}
6284 
6285  /**
6286  Constructs an Item_insert_value that represents a derived table that wraps a
6287  table value constructor.
6288  */
6289  Item_insert_value(Name_resolution_context *context_arg, Item *a)
6290  : Item_field(context_arg, nullptr, nullptr, nullptr),
6291  arg(a),
6292  m_is_values_function(false) {}
6293 
6294  bool itemize(Parse_context *pc, Item **res) override {
6295  if (skip_itemize(res)) return false;
6296  return Item_field::itemize(pc, res) || arg->itemize(pc, &arg);
6297  }
6298 
6299  enum Type type() const override { return INSERT_VALUE_ITEM; }
6300  bool eq(const Item *item, bool binary_cmp) const override;
6301  bool fix_fields(THD *, Item **) override;
6302  void bind_fields() override;
6303  void cleanup() override;
6304  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
6305  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
6306  /*
6307  We use RAND_TABLE_BIT to prevent Item_insert_value from
6308  being treated as a constant and precalculated before execution
6309  */
6310  table_map used_tables() const override { return RAND_TABLE_BIT; }
6311 
6312  bool walk(Item_processor processor, enum_walk walk, uchar *args) override {
6313  return ((walk & enum_walk::PREFIX) && (this->*processor)(args)) ||
6314  arg->walk(processor, walk, args) ||
6315  ((walk & enum_walk::POSTFIX) && (this->*processor)(args));
6316  }
6317  bool check_function_as_value_generator(uchar *args) override {
6318  Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *func_arg =
6319  pointer_cast<Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *>(args);
6320  func_arg->banned_function_name = "values";
6321  return true;
6322  }
6323 
6324  private:
6325  /// The argument for this function
6326  Item *arg;
6327  /// Pointer to row buffer that was used to calculate field value offset
6328  uchar *m_rowbuffer_saved{nullptr};
6329  /**
6330  This flag is true if the item represents a call to the deprecated VALUES
6331  function. It is false if the item represents a derived table that wraps a
6332  table value constructor.
6333  */
6334  const bool m_is_values_function;
6335 };
6336 
6337 /**
6338  Represents NEW/OLD version of field of row which is
6339  changed/read in trigger.
6340 
6341  Note: For this item main part of actual binding to Field object happens
6342  not during fix_fields() call (like for Item_field) but right after
6343  parsing of trigger definition, when table is opened, with special
6344  setup_field() call. On fix_fields() stage we simply choose one of
6345  two Field instances representing either OLD or NEW version of this
6346  field.
6347 */
6348 class Item_trigger_field final : public Item_field,
6349  private Settable_routine_parameter {
6350  public:
6351  /* Is this item represents row from NEW or OLD row ? */
6352  enum_trigger_variable_type trigger_var_type;
6353  /* Next in list of all Item_trigger_field's in trigger */
6354  Item_trigger_field *next_trg_field;
6355  /*
6356  Next list of Item_trigger_field's in "sp_head::
6357  m_list_of_trig_fields_item_lists".
6358  */
6359  SQL_I_List<Item_trigger_field> *next_trig_field_list;
6360  /* Index of the field in the TABLE::field array */
6361  uint field_idx;
6362  /* Pointer to an instance of Table_trigger_field_support interface */
6363  Table_trigger_field_support *triggers;
6364 
6365  Item_trigger_field(Name_resolution_context *context_arg,
6366  enum_trigger_variable_type trigger_var_type_arg,
6367  const char *field_name_arg, ulong priv, const bool ro)
6368  : Item_field(context_arg, nullptr, nullptr, field_name_arg),
6369  trigger_var_type(trigger_var_type_arg),
6370  next_trig_field_list(nullptr),
6371  field_idx((uint)-1),
6372  want_privilege(priv),
6373  table_grants(nullptr),
6374  read_only(ro) {}
6375  Item_trigger_field(const POS &pos,
6376  enum_trigger_variable_type trigger_var_type_arg,
6377  const char *field_name_arg, ulong priv, const bool ro)
6378  : Item_field(pos, nullptr, nullptr, field_name_arg),
6379  trigger_var_type(trigger_var_type_arg),
6380  field_idx((uint)-1),
6381  want_privilege(priv),
6382  table_grants(nullptr),
6383  read_only(ro) {}
6384  void setup_field(Table_trigger_field_support *table_triggers,
6385  GRANT_INFO *table_grant_info);
6386  enum Type type() const override { return TRIGGER_FIELD_ITEM; }
6387  bool eq(const Item *item, bool binary_cmp) const override;
6388  bool fix_fields(THD *, Item **) override;
6389  void bind_fields() override;
6390  bool check_column_privileges(uchar *arg) override;
6391  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
6392  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
6393  table_map used_tables() const override { return INNER_TABLE_BIT; }
6394  Field *get_tmp_table_field() override { return nullptr; }
6395  Item *copy_or_same(THD *) override { return this; }
6396  Item *get_tmp_table_item(THD *thd) override { return copy_or_same(thd); }
6397  void cleanup() override;
6398  void set_required_privilege(ulong privilege) override {
6399  want_privilege = privilege;
6400  }
6401 
6402  bool check_function_as_value_generator(uchar *args) override {
6403  Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *func_arg =
6404  pointer_cast<Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *>(args);
6405  func_arg->err_code = func_arg->get_unnamed_function_error_code();
6406  return true;
6407  }
6408 
6409  private:
6410  bool set_value(THD *thd, sp_rcontext *ctx, Item **it) override;
6411 
6412  public:
6413  Settable_routine_parameter *get_settable_routine_parameter() override {
6414  return (read_only ? nullptr : this);
6415  }
6416 
6417  bool set_value(THD *thd, Item **it) {
6418  bool ret = set_value(thd, nullptr, it);
6419  if (!ret)
6420  bitmap_set_bit(triggers->get_subject_table()->fields_set_during_insert,
6421  field_idx);
6422  return ret;
6423  }
6424 
6425  private:
6426  /*
6427  'want_privilege' holds privileges required to perform operation on
6428  this trigger field (SELECT_ACL if we are going to read it and
6429  UPDATE_ACL if we are going to update it). It is initialized at
6430  parse time but can be updated later if this trigger field is used
6431  as OUT or INOUT parameter of stored routine (in this case
6432  set_required_privilege() is called to appropriately update
6433  want_privilege).
6434  */
6435  ulong want_privilege;
6436  GRANT_INFO *table_grants;
6437  /*
6438  Trigger field is read-only unless it belongs to the NEW row in a
6439  BEFORE INSERT of BEFORE UPDATE trigger.
6440  */
6441  bool read_only;
6442 };
6443 
6444 class Item_cache : public Item_basic_constant {
6445  protected:
6446  Item *example;
6447  table_map used_table_map;
6448  /**
6449  Field that this object will get value from. This is used by
6450  index-based subquery engines to detect and remove the equality injected
6451  by IN->EXISTS transformation.
6452  */
6453  Field *cached_field;
6454  /*
6455  true <=> cache holds value of the last stored item (i.e actual value).
6456  store() stores item to be cached and sets this flag to false.
6457  On the first call of val_xxx function if this flag is set to false the
6458  cache_value() will be called to actually cache value of saved item.
6459  cache_value() will set this flag to true.
6460  */
6461  bool value_cached;
6462 
6463  friend bool has_rollup_result(Item *item);
6464 
6465  public:
6466  Item_cache()
6467  : example(nullptr),
6468  used_table_map(0),
6469  cached_field(nullptr),
6470  value_cached(false) {
6471  fixed = true;
6472  maybe_null = true;
6473  null_value = true;
6474  }
6475  Item_cache(enum_field_types field_type_arg)
6476  : example(nullptr),
6477  used_table_map(0),
6478  cached_field(nullptr),
6479  value_cached(false) {
6480  set_data_type(field_type_arg);
6481  fixed = true;
6482  maybe_null = true;
6483  null_value = true;
6484  }
6485 
6486  void set_used_tables(table_map map) { used_table_map = map; }
6487 
6488  void fix_after_pullout(SELECT_LEX *parent_select,
6489  SELECT_LEX *removed_select) override {
6490  if (example == nullptr) return;
6491  example->fix_after_pullout(parent_select, removed_select);
6492  used_table_map = example->used_tables();
6493  }
6494 
6495  virtual bool allocate(uint) { return false; }
6496  virtual bool setup(Item *item) {
6497  example = item;
6498  max_length = item->max_length;
6499  decimals = item->decimals;
6500  collation.set(item->collation);
6501  unsigned_flag = item->unsigned_flag;
6502  add_accum_properties(item);
6503  if (item->type() == FIELD_ITEM) {
6504  cached_field = ((Item_field *)item)->field;
6505  if (((Item_field *)item)->table_ref)
6506  used_table_map = ((Item_field *)item)->table_ref->map();
6507  } else {
6508  used_table_map = item->used_tables();
6509  }
6510  return false;
6511  }
6512  enum Type type() const override { return CACHE_ITEM; }
6513  static Item_cache *get_cache(const Item *item);
6514  static Item_cache *get_cache(const Item *item, const Item_result type);
6515  table_map used_tables() const override { return used_table_map; }
6516  virtual void keep_array() {}
6517  void print(const THD *thd, String *str,
6518  enum_query_type query_type) const override;
6519  bool eq_def(const Field *field) {
6520  return cached_field && cached_field->eq_def(field);
6521  }
6522  bool eq(const Item *item, bool) const override { return this == item; }
6523  /**
6524  Check if saved item has a non-NULL value.
6525  Will cache value of saved item if not already done.
6526  @return true if cached value is non-NULL.
6527  */
6528  bool has_value();
6529 
6530  /**
6531  If this item caches a field value, return pointer to underlying field.
6532 
6533  @return Pointer to field, or NULL if this is not a cache for a field value.
6534  */
6535  Field *field() { return cached_field; }
6536 
6537  /**
6538  Assigns to the cache the expression to be cached. Does not evaluate it.
6539  @param item the expression to be cached
6540  */
6541  virtual void store(Item *item);
6542 
6543  /**
6544  Force an item to be null. Used for empty subqueries to avoid attempts to
6545  evaluate expressions which could have uninitialized columns due to
6546  bypassing the subquery exec.
6547  */
6548  void store_null() {
6549  DBUG_ASSERT(maybe_null);
6550  value_cached = true;
6551  null_value = true;
6552  }
6553 
6554  virtual bool cache_value() = 0;
6555  bool store_and_cache(Item *item) {
6556  store(item);
6557  return cache_value();
6558  }
6559  void cleanup() override;
6560  bool basic_const_item() const override {
6561  return (example != nullptr && example->basic_const_item());
6562  }
6563  bool walk(Item_processor processor, enum_walk walk, uchar *arg) override;
6564  virtual void clear() {
6565  null_value = true;
6566  value_cached = false;
6567  }
6568  bool is_null() override {
6569  return value_cached ? null_value : example->is_null();
6570  }
6571  bool is_non_const_over_literals(uchar *) override { return true; }
6572  bool check_function_as_value_generator(uchar *args) override {
6573  Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *func_arg =
6574  pointer_cast<Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *>(args);
6575  func_arg->banned_function_name = "cached item";
6576  // This should not happen as SELECT statements are not allowed.
6577  DBUG_ASSERT(false);
6578  return true;
6579  }
6580  Item_result result_type() const override {
6581  if (!example) return INT_RESULT;
6582  return Field::result_merge_type(example->data_type());
6583  }
6584 };
6585 
6586 class Item_cache_int final : public Item_cache {
6587  protected:
6588  longlong value;
6589 
6590  public:
6591  Item_cache_int() : Item_cache(MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG), value(0) {}
6592  Item_cache_int(enum_field_types field_type_arg)
6593  : Item_cache(field_type_arg), value(0) {}
6594 
6595  /**
6596  Unlike store(), this stores an explicitly provided value, not the one of
6597  'item'; however, NULLness is still taken from 'item'.
6598  */
6599  void store_value(Item *item, longlong val_arg);
6600  double val_real() override;
6601  longlong val_int() override;
6602  longlong val_time_temporal() override { return val_int(); }
6603  longlong val_date_temporal() override { return val_int(); }
6604  String *val_str(String *str) override;
6605  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
6606  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override {
6607  return get_date_from_int(ltime, fuzzydate);
6608  }
6609  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override { return get_time_from_int(ltime); }
6610  Item_result result_type() const override { return INT_RESULT; }
6611  bool cache_value() override;
6612 };
6613 
6614 class Item_cache_real final : public Item_cache {
6615  double value;
6616 
6617  public:
6618  Item_cache_real() : Item_cache(MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE), value(0) {}
6619 
6620  double val_real() override;
6621  longlong val_int() override;
6622  String *val_str(String *str) override;
6623  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
6624  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override {
6625  return get_date_from_real(ltime, fuzzydate);
6626  }
6627  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override {
6628  return get_time_from_real(ltime);
6629  }
6630  Item_result result_type() const override { return REAL_RESULT; }
6631  bool cache_value() override;
6632  void store_value(Item *expr, double value);
6633 };
6634 
6635 class Item_cache_decimal final : public Item_cache {
6636  protected:
6637  my_decimal decimal_value;
6638 
6639  public:
6640  Item_cache_decimal() : Item_cache(MYSQL_TYPE_NEWDECIMAL) {}
6641 
6642  double val_real() override;
6643  longlong val_int() override;
6644  String *val_str(String *str) override;
6645  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
6646  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override {
6647  return get_date_from_decimal(ltime, fuzzydate);
6648  }
6649  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override {
6650  return get_time_from_decimal(ltime);
6651  }
6652  Item_result result_type() const override { return DECIMAL_RESULT; }
6653  bool cache_value() override;
6654  void store_value(Item *expr, my_decimal *d);
6655 };
6656 
6657 class Item_cache_str final : public Item_cache {
6658  char buffer[STRING_BUFFER_USUAL_SIZE];
6659  String *value, value_buff;
6660  bool is_varbinary;
6661 
6662  protected:
6663  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
6664  bool no_conversions) override;
6665 
6666  public:
6667  Item_cache_str(const Item *item)
6668  : Item_cache(item->data_type()),
6669  value(nullptr),
6670  is_varbinary(item->type() == FIELD_ITEM &&
6671  data_type() == MYSQL_TYPE_VARCHAR &&
6672  !((const Item_field *)item)->field->has_charset()) {
6673  collation.set(item->collation);
6674  }
6675  double val_real() override;
6676  longlong val_int() override;
6677  String *val_str(String *) override;
6678  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
6679  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override {
6680  return get_date_from_string(ltime, fuzzydate);
6681  }
6682  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override {
6683  return get_time_from_string(ltime);
6684  }
6685  Item_result result_type() const override { return STRING_RESULT; }
6686  const CHARSET_INFO *charset() const { return value->charset(); }
6687  bool cache_value() override;
6688  void store_value(Item *expr, String &s);
6689 };
6690 
6691 class Item_cache_row final : public Item_cache {
6692  Item_cache **values;
6693  uint item_count;
6694 
6695  public:
6696  Item_cache_row() : Item_cache(), values(nullptr), item_count(2) {}
6697 
6698  /**
6699  'allocate' is only used in Item_cache_row::setup()
6700  */
6701  bool allocate(uint num) override;
6702  /*
6703  'setup' is needed only by row => it not called by simple row subselect
6704  (only by IN subselect (in subselect optimizer))
6705  */
6706  bool setup(Item *item) override;
6707  void store(Item *item) override;
6708  void illegal_method_call(const char *) const MY_ATTRIBUTE((cold));
6709  void make_field(Send_field *) override { illegal_method_call("make_field"); }
6710  double val_real() override {
6711  illegal_method_call("val_real");
6712  return 0;
6713  }
6714  longlong val_int() override {
6715  illegal_method_call("val_int");
6716  return 0;
6717  }
6718  String *val_str(String *) override {
6719  illegal_method_call("val_str");
6720  return nullptr;
6721  }
6722  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override {
6723  illegal_method_call("val_decimal");
6724  return nullptr;
6725  }
6726  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *, my_time_flags_t) override {
6727  illegal_method_call("get_date");
6728  return true;
6729  }
6730  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *) override {
6731  illegal_method_call("get_time");
6732  return true;
6733  }
6734 
6735  Item_result result_type() const override { return ROW_RESULT; }
6736 
6737  uint cols() const override { return item_count; }
6738  Item *element_index(uint i) override { return values[i]; }
6739  Item **addr(uint i) override { return (Item **)(values + i); }
6740  bool check_cols(uint c) override;
6741  bool null_inside() override;
6742  void bring_value() override;
6743  void cleanup() override { Item_cache::cleanup(); }
6744  bool cache_value() override;
6745 };
6746 
6747 class Item_cache_datetime : public Item_cache {
6748  String cached_string;
6749 
6750  protected:
6751  longlong int_value;
6752  bool str_value_cached;
6753 
6754  public:
6755  Item_cache_datetime(enum_field_types field_type_arg)
6756  : Item_cache(field_type_arg), int_value(0), str_value_cached(false) {
6757  cmp_context = STRING_RESULT;
6758  }
6759 
6760  void store_value(Item *item, longlong val_arg);
6761  void store(Item *item) override;
6762  double val_real() override;
6763  longlong val_int() override;
6764  longlong val_time_temporal() override;
6765  longlong val_date_temporal() override;
6766  String *val_str(String *str) override;
6767  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
6768  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override;
6769  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override;
6770  Item_result result_type() const override { return STRING_RESULT; }
6771  /*
6772  In order to avoid INT <-> STRING conversion of a DATETIME value
6773  two cache_value functions are introduced. One (cache_value) caches STRING
6774  value, another (cache_value_int) - INT value. Thus this cache item
6775  completely relies on the ability of the underlying item to do the
6776  correct conversion.
6777  */
6778  bool cache_value_int();
6779  bool cache_value() override;
6780  void clear() override {
6781  Item_cache::clear();
6782  str_value_cached = false;
6783  }
6784 };
6785 
6786 /// An item cache for values of type JSON.
6787 class Item_cache_json : public Item_cache {
6788  /// Cached value
6789  Json_wrapper *m_value;
6790  /// Whether the cached value is array and it is sorted
6791  bool m_is_sorted;
6792 
6793  public:
6794  Item_cache_json();
6795  ~Item_cache_json() override;
6796  bool cache_value() override;
6797  void store_value(Item *expr, Json_wrapper *wr);
6798  bool val_json(Json_wrapper *wr) override;
6799  longlong val_int() override;
6800  String *val_str(String *str) override;
6801  Item_result result_type() const override { return STRING_RESULT; }
6802 
6803  double val_real() override;
6804  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *val) override;
6805  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override;
6806  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override;
6807  /// Sort cached data. Only arrays are affected.
6808  void sort();
6809  /// Returns true when cached value is array and it's sorted
6810  bool is_sorted() { return m_is_sorted; }
6811 };
6812 
6813 /**
6814  Interface for storing an aggregation of type and type specification of
6815  multiple Item objects.
6816 
6817  This is useful for cases where a field is an amalgamation of multiple types,
6818  such as in UNION where type conversions must be done to a common denominator.
6819 */
6820 class Item_aggregate_type : public Item {
6821  protected:
6822  TYPELIB *enum_set_typelib;
6823  Field::geometry_type geometry_type;
6824 
6825  void get_full_info(Item *item);
6826 
6827  public:
6828  Item_aggregate_type(THD *, Item *);
6829 
6830  double val_real() override = 0;
6831  longlong val_int() override = 0;
6832  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override = 0;
6833  String *val_str(String *) override = 0;
6834  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *, my_time_flags_t) override = 0;
6835  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *) override = 0;
6836 
6837  Item_result result_type() const override;
6838  bool join_types(THD *, Item *);
6839  Field *make_field_by_type(TABLE *table, bool strict);
6840  static uint32 display_length(Item *item);
6841  Field::geometry_type get_geometry_type() const override {
6842  return geometry_type;
6843  }
6844  void make_field(Send_field *field) override {
6845  Item::make_field(field);
6846  // Item_type_holder is used for unions and effectively sends Fields
6847  field->field = true;
6848  }
6849  bool check_function_as_value_generator(uchar *args) override {
6850  Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *func_arg =
6851  pointer_cast<Check_function_as_value_generator_parameters *>(args);
6852  func_arg->err_code = func_arg->get_unnamed_function_error_code();
6853  return true;
6854  }
6855 };
6856 
6857 /**
6858  Item_type_holder stores an aggregation of name, type and type specification of
6859  UNIONS and derived tables.
6860 */
6861 class Item_type_holder final : public Item_aggregate_type {
6862  typedef Item_aggregate_type super;
6863 
6864  public:
6865  /// @todo Consider giving Item_type_holder objects default names from the item
6866  /// they are initialized by. This would ensure that
6867  /// SELECT_LEX_UNIT::get_unit_column_types() always contains named items.
6868  Item_type_holder(THD *thd, Item *item) : super(thd, item) {}
6869 
6870  enum Type type() const override { return TYPE_HOLDER; }
6871 
6872  double val_real() override;
6873  longlong val_int() override;
6874  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
6875  String *val_str(String *) override;
6876  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *, my_time_flags_t) override;
6877  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *) override;
6878 };
6879 
6880 /**
6881  Reference item that encapsulates both the type and the contained items of a
6882  single column of a VALUES ROW query expression.
6883 
6884  During execution, the item that will be output for the current iteration is
6885  contained in m_value_ref. The type of the column and the referenced item may
6886  differ in cases where a column of a VALUES clause contains different types
6887  across different rows, and must therefore do type conversions to their common
6888  denominator (e.g. a column containing both 10 and "10", of which the types
6889  will be aggregated into VARCHAR).
6890 
6891  See the class comment for TableValueConstructorIterator for info on how
6892  Item_values_column is used as an indirection to iterate over the rows of a
6893  table value constructor (i.e. VALUES ROW expressions).
6894 */
6895 class Item_values_column final : public Item_aggregate_type {
6896  typedef Item_aggregate_type super;
6897 
6898  private:
6899  Item *m_value_ref{nullptr};
6900  /*
6901  Even if a table value constructor contains only constant values, we
6902  still need to identify individual rows within it. Set RAND_TABLE_BIT
6903  to ensure that all rows are scanned, and that the whole VALUES clause
6904  is never substituted with a const value or row.
6905  */
6906  table_map m_aggregated_used_tables{RAND_TABLE_BIT};
6907 
6908  type_conversion_status save_in_field_inner(Field *field,
6909  bool no_conversions) override;
6910 
6911  public:
6912  Item_values_column(THD *thd, Item *ref);
6913 
6914  bool eq(const Item *item, bool binary_cmp) const override;
6915  double val_real() override;
6916  longlong val_int() override;
6917  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *) override;
6918  bool val_bool() override;
6919  String *val_str(String *tmp) override;
6920  bool val_json(Json_wrapper *result) override;
6921  bool is_null() override;
6922  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t fuzzydate) override;
6923  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override;
6924 
6925  enum Type type() const override { return VALUES_COLUMN_ITEM; }
6926  void set_value(Item *new_value) { m_value_ref = new_value; }
6927  table_map used_tables() const override { return m_aggregated_used_tables; }
6928  void add_used_tables(Item *value);
6929 };
6930 
6931 /// A class that represents a constant JSON value.
6932 class Item_json final : public Item_basic_constant {
6933  unique_ptr_destroy_only<Json_wrapper> m_value;
6934 
6935  public:
6936  Item_json(unique_ptr_destroy_only<Json_wrapper> value,
6937  const Item_name_string &name);
6938  ~Item_json() override;
6939  enum Type type() const override { return STRING_ITEM; }
6940  void print(const THD *, String *str, enum_query_type) const override;
6941  bool val_json(Json_wrapper *result) override;
6942  Item_result result_type() const override { return STRING_RESULT; }
6943  double val_real() override;
6944  longlong val_int() override;
6945  String *val_str(String *str) override;
6946  my_decimal *val_decimal(my_decimal *buf) override;
6947  bool get_date(MYSQL_TIME *ltime, my_time_flags_t) override;
6948  bool get_time(MYSQL_TIME *ltime) override;
6949  Item *clone_item() const override;
6950 };

6960  const CHARSET_INFO *to_cs);

6962 std::string ItemToString(const Item *item);
6963 
6964 inline size_t CountVisibleFields(const mem_root_deque<Item *> &fields) {
6965  return std::count_if(fields.begin(), fields.end(),
6966  [](Item *item) { return !item->hidden; });
6967 }
6968 
6969 inline size_t CountHiddenFields(const mem_root_deque<Item *> &fields) {
6970  return std::count_if(fields.begin(), fields.end(),
6971  [](Item *item) { return item->hidden; });
6972 }
6973 
6974 inline Item *GetNthVisibleField(const mem_root_deque<Item *> &fields,
6975  size_t index) {
6976  for (Item *item : fields) {
6977  if (item->hidden) continue;
6978  if (index-- == 0) return item;
6979  }
6980  assert(false);
6981  return nullptr;
6982 }
